He opened an account with Amasezerano Community Banking in 2007. With this loan, he wishes to increase his savings in order to repair his house. An increase in his business income will allow him to pay his childrens’ school fees, improve living conditions for his family, and have a large store in the future.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, salt, and soaps

loans.name: God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Macia C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God We Trust. She is 37 years old, single and has three children who range from 6 to 14 years old.  She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to a lack of financial support. 

For 8 years, she has been selling sugar, flour, palm oil and rice in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 26,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more sugar, flour, palm oil and rice. She describes herself as a devoted mother.

Her goal is to improve her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour, palm oil and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, palm oil, sugar, flour and beans

loans.name: Costa Brava Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Costa Brava se eligió este nombre para este grupo, por L. región D. L. costa D. Pinotepa Nacional, esta historia es acerca del señor Joniy D. L. C. Morales es uno D. los integrantes D. este grupo, el es casado, tiene 30 años es padre D. un niño D. 3 años y es carpintero.

El nos platica que se decidió por este oficio ya que lo aprendió desD. que era niño ya que su papá era carpintero y le heredo las herramientas para que el siguiera trabajando, dice que es un buen negocio ya que se obtienen muy buenos ingresos, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en L. compra D. mas materiales para seguir trabajando como: madera, pegamento y pintura. 

Las ganancias que obtiene D. L. venta D. su negocio, le están beneficiando mucho a el y a su familia, ya que ahora están pudiendo tener un poco mas D. solvencia económica y ahora que ya su hijo va a entrar al preescolar y tienen que comprarle su material escolar también le esta ayudando D. mucho. 

Dice que con su negocio esta beneficiando mucho a las personas D. su comunidad ya que no hay muchas carpinterías en L. población y tienen que ir muy lejos para poder encargar lo que necesitan, pero ahora ya no lo que hacen, puesto que tuenen L. carpintería D. Don Joniy  muy cerca.

El propósito que el tiene es ver crecer a su hijo y apoyarlo para que siga estudiando, y pueda tener una carrera y una muy buena profesión, también desea tener una carpintería mas granD.  para apoyar a su mamá, ya que L. señora es viuda y él L. ayuda económicamente y para mejorar su nivel D. vida.

Platica que todos los integrantes D. su grupo, son muy confiables, responsables y trabajadores ya que tienen tiempo D. conocerse.

El señor Joniy da las gracias a FRAC y KIVA por que gracias a ellos ha podido lograr tener su propio negocio y asi cambiar su vida y L. D. su familia.

Los integrantes D. costa brava y las actividades a L. que se dedican son las siguientes:
Joniy D. L. C. Morales-carpintería
Clemencia Marroquín R.-antojitos
Albina D. L. R.-repostería
Nelida Cristina M. C.-repostería
Sixto Ricardo H. S.-carpintería
Gloria López C.-tienda D. ropa
Jacinto Raúl López T.-lavado D. autos
Florentino P.-pescadería
FabioL. Leonarda López Damián-antojitos
Valenta S. Nicolás-tienda D. ropa
texts.en:
The group is called Costa Brava after the region of the National Pinotepa coast. This is the story of Joniy D. L. C. Morales, one of the group members. He is married, 30 years old, the father of a three-year old boy and a carpenter. He explains that he chose this profession because he learned it as a child as his father was a carpenter and left him his tools so he'd be able to work. He says it is a good business that provides him with a good income. He is going to use the loan to invest in the purchase of materials to continue working, including wood, glue and paint. The earnings he is getting out of the business benefit him and his family very much. He is now financially more secure, which is going to help now that his son is starting preschool and they will have to buy school materials for him. He also says that his business is benefitting the community as there aren't many carpenters in the town and people used to have to go far to order what they need. That's no longer the case, as they now have Joiy's carpenter's worshop nearby. His main goal is to see his son grow up and support him through his studies so that he can have a career and a good profession. He would also like a larger workshop to support his mother, who is a widow and whom he helps financially, and to improve his standard of living. He mentions that all group members are very reliable and responsible workers now they have had the chance to know each other. Joniy would like to thank FRAC and KIVA because they have enabled him to own his own business and change his life and his family's. Costa Brava group members and their business activities are: Joniy D. L. C. Morales - carpentry M. Clemencia R. - snacks Albina D. L. R. - confectionery Nelida Cristina M. C. - confectionery Sixto Ricardo H. S. - carpentry Gloria L. C. - clothing store Jacinto Raul L. T. - car wash Florentino Pena -fishmongers FabioL. Leonarda L. D. -snacks Valenta S. N. - clothing store

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and paint

loans.name: Lekitony Ole

texts.en:
Lekitony Ole S. is 47 years old. He is married to Nalangu S. and is a father of four children all attending school. Lekitony is a farmer and he has been farming for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his first loan and he is planning to purchase fertilizer for his maize farm and chemicals for his wheat farm. Wheat and maize have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to expand his farming activities from small scale to commercial farming.

Lekitony’s dream is to do large scale farming and buy his own farm machinery. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals for his farms

loans.name: Yapuchiri Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “YAPUCHIRI”, (sembrador en idioma aymara) es una asociación que solicita crédito por tercera vez, es parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho personas, tienen como presidenta a la señora Sinforosa A.. 

La presidenta, Sinforosa A., desde hace dos años elabora artesanía en tejido. La venta es realizada en las avenidas céntricas de la ciudad de La Paz, los días sábados y domingos. Le ayudan a tejer tres señoras. Este tipo de negocio le permite a la señora atender su hogar, pues  está casada y tiene seis hijos.

Este primer crédito fue por Bs.1200.-, actualmente la asociación le aprobó Bs.3000.-, ella indica que le servirá para la compra de materia prima, es decir lana.
 
En el caso de las  integrantes de la asociación comunal, tienen diversos negocios, como: venta de ropa, venta de comida, comerciante, sombrerería, venta de cosméticos, venta de víveres, tejido de mantas.
texts.en:
The “YAPUCHIRI” (Planter in Aymara) communal bank is an association that is seeking funds for the third time. It is part of the German Busch Focus Center and it has 8 members; its president is Mrs. Sinforosa A.. Mrs. A. has been a weaver for the last two years. She carries out her sales along La Paz’s downtown streets on Saturdays and Sundays. Three women help her weave. This type of business allows her to tend to her home because she’s married and has six children. The first loan was for Bs.1200 and currently she was approved for a Bs. 3000 loan. She indicates that it will be used to buy raw materials, that is to say, wool. With respect to the rest of the group members, they have a variety of business such as: clothing sales, food sales, some are merchants, hat makers, cosmetics sales, grocery sales and blanket weavers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of vegetable oil

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Bimala N., who is married and has three children aged 16, 12, and 9, supports her family by working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day in her grocery shop business which she established in 2007. Bimala has already received and repaid one loan from Patan BPW which she used to increase store inventory, the same intended purpose behind her request for a new loan. In the future, she plans to expand the business. Bimala thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While typical pasals might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business-training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buy more goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Ouleye

texts.fr:
Madame Ouleye S. habite  à Ngor, un des villages environnants de la localité de Ouakam. Elle est âgée  de 51 ans. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 4 enfants. 
Madame S.  a voulu trouver une solution aux difficultés  qu’elle traversait et c’est la raison  qui l’a pousse a choisir   l’activité  de commerce  comme occupation dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Ainsi elle pratique la vente de produits locaux et de beignets depuis 10 ans. 
Madame S. est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC  à Ouakam  depuis  3 ans. Elle y a déjà  bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 300 000 frs qui sera destine à augmenter son fond de roulement  afin de renforcer son stock de produits. 
Ce crédit  selon elle pourra contribuer à développer  et faire avancer son activité. Aussi  ceci pourrait accroitre ses revenus  ce qui lui donnera la possibilité  de participer  a la gestion des charges  de la famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Ouleye S. lives in Ngor, a village near Ouakam. She is 51 years old, married with 4 children. Mrs. S. started her business to earn income because she wanted to find a way out of the difficulties she was facing. This is how she came to be in the business of selling local produce and fritters for more than ten years. Mrs. S. has been a member of the UIMCEC bank in Ouakam for the past 3 years. She has already had one loan, and she is now asking for a new loan of 300,000 francs that will increase her working capital so that she can increase her inventory. She expects that this loan will allow her to grow her business and increase her income, which in turn will allow her to contribute to the family expenses.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: G.s. Mi Divino Niño Ii Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Mi Divino Niño II está conformado por Maria Concepción y Nora Yessenia ambas son personas muy responsables y disfrutan de sus actividades. En el caso de Maria se dedica a una pulpería, desde hace más de 12 años, por lo que decide  seguir adelante con esta actividad que es su medio de vida para seguir proporcionando a su familia los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante. En cambio Nora que se dedica a la venta de ropa hace más de 15 años, ya que ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. Pues juntas están solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima e invertir en inventario en sus negocios. Sueñan con mantener estables sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Mi Divino Niño II" consists of Maria Concepción and Nora Yessenia. They are both very responsible people and enjoy their businesses. Maria has been running a grocery store for over 12 years. This is her livelihood and has allowed her to provide her family with the necessary income to get ahead. Nora has been selling clothes for over 15 years and has proven to be a responsible person. Both are requesting this loan to purchase raw materials and to invest in inventory for their businesses. Their dream is to keep their businesses stable.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa S. S. tiene 20 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, tiene 2 hijos, Elkim (3) y Marlon (2 meses), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Carmen  es un socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Carmen  tiene una tienda y un bazar en donde vende víveres de primera necesidad y cosas plásticas. Realiza sus compras en Milagro Naranjito y Guayaquil y vende en un local de la casa.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la tienda que tiene en la casa. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para sacar adelante a los hijos. Enfrenta desafíos la competencia de la localidad.

Le gusta arreglar la tienda.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa S. S. is 20 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She has 2 children, Elkim (3) and Marlon (2 months), and she lives in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar province. Carmen is a member of the Rey de Reyes ("King of Kings") communal bank, which is located one and a half hours from Chillanes. The group has a total of 23 members, most of whom work in agriculture. This is their first loan with the San José Cooperative. Carmen has a small grocery and general store, in which she sells basic grocery items and plastic goods. She buys her merchandise in the cities of Milagro, Naranjito and Guayaquil, and she sells it in her store, which is located in her home. She is requesting the loan to invest in the store she operates in her home. She believes that the loan will offer her an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to have enough money to help her children get a good start in life. Her main challenge is the local competition. She enjoys fixing up her store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the store she runs in her home

loans.name: Yuri Liliana

texts.es:
Yuri Liliana M. B. tiene 23 años. Es soltera vive con los padres y con la hija, Emily (3), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Yuri  es un socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Yuri tiene un bazar en donde vende yambal como perfumes, maquillajes, cremas entre otras cosas. Realiza sus compras en Milagro Guayaquil y vende en un local de la casa.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el bazar que tiene en la casa Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para sacar adelante a su hijo. Enfrenta desafíos la competencia de la localidad.

Le gusta escuchar música y la natación.
texts.en:
Yuri Liliana M. B. is 23 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and her daughter Emily (3). She lives in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar province. Yuri is a member of the Rey de Reyes ("King of Kings") communal bank, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. The group has a total of 23 members, most of whom work in agriculture. This is their first loan with the San José Cooperative. Yuri has a small store in which she sells Yanbal products, such as perfumes, makeup, creams and other items. She buys her merchandise in Milagro and Guayaquil, and sells it in a store within her home. She is requesting the loan to invest in the store she operates in her home. She believes that the loan represents an opportunity for her to get ahead. Her dream is to have enough money to help her child get a good start in life. Her main challenge is the competition in her area. She likes to swim and listen to music.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the store she runs in her home

loans.name: Flor Kantutita Group

texts.es:
C.F. GERMAN BUSCH
A.C. FLOR KANTUTITA
FECHA: 15/07/2010

La Asociación Comunal “FLOR KANTUTITA”, es una asociación que solicita crédito por cuarta vez, es parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve personas, tienen como presidenta a la señora Rosario del Carmen L. C.. 

La señora Rosario del Carmen L. C. trabaja en Pro Mujer desde hace 3 ciclos (aproximadamente un año y medio).  Tiene como negocio la venta de comida desde hace ocho años. La venta es realizada en la Zona de Alto Lima. 

El primer crédito fue por Bs.1500.-, actualmente la asociación le aprobó Bs.3500.-, ella indica que le servirá para la compra de víveres al por mayor.
 
En el caso de las  integrantes de la asociación comunal, tienen diversos negocios, como: venta de telas, venta de comida, comerciante, venta de cosméticos, confección de chompas de cuello alto, pasanaku (sistema de ahorro diario, no formal), producción y venta de CD, DVD´s, VCD.
texts.en:
Regional Office GERMAN BUSCH Communal Bank “FLOR KANTUTITA” Date: 07/15/2010 The communal bank “Flor Kantutita” is requesting a loan for the fourth time; it is a part of the German Busch Regional Office. It is made up of nine people. Their President is Rosario del Carmen L. C.. Rosario del Carmen L. C. has worked with Pro Mujer for 3 loan cycles (approximately 1.5 years). Her business for the past eight years has been selling food. She sells in the neighborhood of Alto Lima. Her first loan was for Bs. 1,500.00. Currently the communal bank has approved her to receive Bs. 3,500.00. She says that she will use it to buy foodstuffs at wholesale prices. The members of the communal bank have several types of businesses, such as: Selling fabrics, selling food, general sales, selling cosmetics, making turtle-neck sweaters, pasanaku (an informal system of daily savings), and making and selling CDs, DVDs, and VCDs.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items at whole-sale prices

loans.name: Julio Fernando

texts.es:
Julio Fernando V. S. tiene 67 años. Es divorciado vive con la mama y con la hija, Amada, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Julio  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Julio  se dedica a la siembra de arroz maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos de arroz, maíz y cacao. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener riego en sus cultivos sobre todo en la de cacao. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima.

Le gusta podar y curar las enfermedades de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Julio Fernando V. S. is 67 years old. He is divorced and lives with his mother and his daughter. He lives in the cantón of Chillanes in the Bolívar province. Julio is a member of the “Rey de Reyes” (King of Kings) communal bank, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members in total, most of whom are farmers. This is the first loan they will have borrowed from Cooperativa San José. Julio plants rice, corn, and cacao. He makes his purchases in Bucay every month and that is also where he sells his crops. He is requesting the loan to buy seed to plant his rice, corn, and cacao crops. He thinks the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is have irrigation for his crops, especially for his cacao; he faces challenges caused by the weather. He likes to prune his crops and treat their diseases.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds for his rice, corn, and cacao crops

loans.name: The Lord Is My Shepherd Group

texts.en:
Miatta D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called The Lord Is My Shepherd. She is 65 years old, widowed and has five children who range from 30 to 50 years old. 

She was not privileged to attend school through to completion due to poverty. For 15 years now she has been selling charcoal in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She describes herself as a friendly woman. Her goal is to improve her business and to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with one child who is not yet old enough to attend school. She has been operating her business of selling charcoal and fresh fish to her neighbors and others for the past five years from home and at the market. 

With the loan of Kshs 30,000, Saumu wants to purchase ten bags of charcoal and a large amount of fresh water fish to re-sell. She experiences the major challenges of seasonality and competition in her business. 

With the profits from this loan, Saumu hopes to add some new rental rooms to earn more income. She currently rents a house with no electricity and piped water. Her biggest monthly expense is food. 

Saumu decided to work with Kiva Field Partner Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase ten bags of charcoal and fresh water fish.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza tiene su domicilio propio en la localidad de el torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, en el barrio Miraflores, es viuda, tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, su única fuente de ingreso es la venta de comida desde hace un año,  antes se dedicaba a l a venta de verduras en el mercado central de la comunidad, también cuenta con la renta que percibe por indemnización de parte de su esposo, el destino del préstamo es para terminar de construir en su vivienda y necesita comprar materiales para de construccion, como ser Cemento, loza, pintura, etc,  es clienta antigua de nuestra institución, por lo cual se siente agradecida por el buen trato que se le ha brindado durante este tiempo.
texts.en:
Esperanza has her own house in the area of El Torno, which is 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz, in the Miraflores neighborhood. She is a widow and has two children who are school-age. Her only source of income is the food stand she has had for one year. Before that she sold vegetables in the central market of the community. She also receives a payment for indemnity for her husband’s death. The loan will be used to finish building her house and she needs to buy materials for construction, such as cement, floor tiles, paint, etc. She is a longstanding client of our institution and she feels grateful for the good treatment that has been shown her during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Rosa Gladyz

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 26años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el sector Casablanca, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, zona caractrizada por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de animales desde hace seis años. Ella compra animales de poca edad para criarlos y luego venderlos en el mercado de Lambayeque y ocasionalmente a los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive. Usualmente cría ovejas y aves de corral. Este negocio es la fuente más estable de ingreso con la que cuenta ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero agrícola. 

Rosa se ha propuesto seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su esposo y darle a su familia la oportunidad de superarse, por ello desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar su nivel de ventas. Para lograr su meta se ha propuesto solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa yn crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Rosa ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva, ella se encuentra muy agredcida con las personas que le ayudaron a crecer como empresaria, por el momento sigue trabajando arduamente para lograr su más grande anhelo: brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de progresar en el futuro. Rosa es una madre responsable y que siempre vela por el bienestar de los suyos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 2 children in the sector of Casablanca, a rural zone of Mórrope district. It's characterized as a rural, sparsely populated zone that belongs to Lambayeque province, located an hour from Chiclayo city. Rosa buys, raises and sells small livestock. She has done this for the past 6 years. After raising the animals she sells them in the Lambayeque market and sometims to visiting dealers. She usually raises sheep and poultry. This work is her most stable source of income, since her husband is a seasonal farm worker. She will keep working to help her husband and to provide her family with the opportunity to improve itself. It is for her family's sake that she hopes to expand her business by purchasing more animals and enriched feed, thus increasing sales. To reach her goal, Rosa has applied for a 1,500 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Rosa has previously worked with Kiva and she is very grateful to the people who helped her grow as an entrepreneur. Rosa continues to work hard towards her biggest dream: to provide her children with the opportunity to advance in the future. She is a responsible mother who always watches over the wellbeing of her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock and enriched animal feed to expand livestock business.

loans.name: Mobateli Plus Group

texts.en:
Freddy is the chairman of a community bank named “Mobateli Plus”, which is composed of 19 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Freddy is 32 years old and single. He runs a telephone booth, a beauty shop and sells beverages. He started selling beverages in 2005 with a beginning capital of $50. With hard work and determination, his business prospered and he diversified by opening a telephone booth and a beauty shop. 

His businesses are located in the heart of the city of Kinshasa. He has already received five loans from Hope DRC and repaid them correctly. Freddy intends with the next loan to purchase a freezer and 30 prepaid cards. He will also use the loan as working capital to increase his inventory.

He makes $60 profit each week. His ambition is to open a drugstore in his area.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and prepaid cards and to increase his inventory

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Glory Be To God Group-Jinja

texts.en:
It is close to six years now since 37-year-old married G. Rose began her beauty salon business in Nukabenge-Jinja. She had to go through an apprentice training mill with her mother to learn how to braid and weave hair. 

She was previously involved in a dairy business that has since closed. By the time it closed, though, she had already got more than a broad hint of how to run a business, having studied how her mum managed her finances. Her minimal story, she says, exemplifies hard work. 

She is a happy-go-lucky married mother of two. With this loan she is anticipating that she will be in position to buy a modern hair dryer. She reckons that her weekly profits of $22 will also increase after she revamps her beauty salon.

loans.use: The purchase of a modern hair dryer for her beauty salon

loans.name: I Trust God #2. Group

texts.en:
Mamie S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "I Trust God #2".  She is 52 years old, single, and has five children who range from 9 to 23 years old. She was not privileged to attend school due to poverty. 

For twelve years, she has been operating a mini-restaurant in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 LRD portion of this 50,000 LRD group loan to buy more rice, meat, fish, cooking oil etc. She describes herself as a friendly woman.

Her goal is to improve her business, build a house and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mamie is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more rice, meat, fish, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Willian Rolando

texts.es:
Willian Rolando C. T. tiene 35 años. El estado civil es unión libre vive con la señora Elizabeth, tiene dos  hijos, Fabricio (9) y Mateo (2), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Willian  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Willian se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y piña. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de un terreno. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Willian Rolando C. T. is 35 years old. He lives with his partner, Elizabeth, and their 2 sons Fabricio, 9, and Mateo, 2. They live in the village of Chillanes, Bolívar province. William is a member of the rural community bank group Rey de Reyes (King of Kings), which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members in all, most of whom are farmers. This will be the group's first loan from Cooperativa San José. William farms maize and pineapples. He buys his farming supplies in Bucay every month and also sells his harvest there. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds for the next planting season. This loan will be an opportunity for him to grow. His dream is to have money to buy land. A challenge he faces is the weather. William likes playing sports in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in seeds for next season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of iron.

loans.name: Jinja Central B-Jinja Group

texts.en:
Looking at somebody’s end of month balance sheets can give you a fair or relative idea of how well their business is doing. If you take the example of 38-year-old divorced N. Florence, a shoe seller for seven years now, you will be brought to terms with her variable business prospects.

In a week, this diligent lady makes about $67, and in a month she gets approximately $266. This is notwithstanding the operational cost challenges of running a business. Her shoe selling business profits have permitted her to shoulder most of her family’s financial requirements. 

All of her four buoyant children are happily in school. She has also been eking side profits from another lucrative business - raising poultry. With this loan, she wants to purchase more pairs of shoes that she will later resell to her increasing clientele. She envisages a situation where she will be able to see her balance sheet triple what she is making now.

loans.use: The purchase of more shoes to resell

loans.name: Budondo Development Association-Jinja Group

texts.en:
Sixteen years down the road is not easy mileage, especially when you are talking about operating a business in a rural area such as Budondo-Jinja. 

The poultry business that 56-year-old B. Feibe runs could be bringing her more profits if she were operating in an urban setting. Chicken is a highly favored delicacy in urban areas in Uganda. Despite this fact she has to find a way to make ends meet. While $22 may be minimal for this married mother of 13, she knows she has her responsibilities cut out for her, bearing in mind the many children she has. 

She began this business after she got apprentice training from the national agricultural advisory service people in her rural area. She initially began with farming. She still runs her farm. With this loan, Feibe says she wants to buy more layer chickens for her business. In the course of time she says she will resell so that she can increase her profit margins.

loans.use: To buy more layer chickens that she will eventually resell.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Madame Mariama O. is 32 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. Since 2001 she has run a general store where she sells various grocery items, jewelry, and charcoal from her home. She is married to a forester and they have four children. 

In order to improve the sustainability of her business, Madame O. has requested a loan of 300,000 XOF from WAGES. She hopes to purchase merchandise for her store like foodstuffs, jewelry and charcoal. The loan will help her pay for these goods as well as their transportation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Gabriela Belén

texts.es:
Gabriela Belén G. G. tiene 20 años. Es soltera vive con los padres, no tiene hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
 
Gabriela  es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Gabriela se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y crianza de pollos. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos y para comprar animales. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de un terreno. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima y las enfermedades.

Le gusta leer la Biblia.
texts.en:
Gabriela Belen G. G. is 20 years old, single, and has no children. Currently, she lives with her parents in the Chillanes region of the Bolivar province. She is a member of a communal bank called Rey de Reyes (King of Kings), which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members total, and the majority make a living through agriculture. This is the first loan they are taking out with the Cooperativa San Jose. Gabriela works in agriculture, planting corn and raising chickens. She makes her purchases each month in Bucay and sells her products at the same location. She is requesting this loan to invest in seeds for her cultivations and to purchase more animals. She thinks that this credit is a good opportunity for her to get ahead. Her dream is to have enough money to buy a plot of land. However, she faces challenges, such as the climate and disease.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in seeds for her cultivations and to purchase more animals

loans.name: Franklin Argemerio

texts.es:
Franklin Argemerio A. T. tiene 33 años. Es soltero vive con los padres,  tiene 1 hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Franklin es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Franklin se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima y las enfermedades.

Le gusta la agricultura.
texts.en:
Franklin Argemerio A. T. is 33 years old. He is single, has a son, and lives with his parents. He lives in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

Franklin is a member of the Rey de Reyes rural communal bank, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are taking out with Cooperativa San José.

Franklin works in agriculture planting corn. He makes his purchases each month in Bucay and he sells them in the same area.

He is requesting this loan to invest in seeds for his crops. He feels that the loan is a way of getting ahead. His dream is to have money to purchase a house. The challenges that he faces are the weather and diseases.

He likes agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in seeds for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more phone cards.

loans.name: Mapendo Plus Group

texts.en:
Claude Niangala, 49, is the manager of the Community Bank named “Mapendo Plus.” It is composed of 18 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Claude has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1995, having already received and repaid seven MFI HOPE DRC loans. A beverage-seller in the south-west part of Kinshasa, Claude will use the new loan he is requesting to buy more crates of drinks to retail, with the goal of increasing his profits. His business generates a profit of $60 per week, and his ambition is to become a beverage provider in his area and open a drugstore. Claude is married and the father of four children whose ages range from 8 and 15. All of them attend school.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beverages to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kwezimba Bugalya, Mubende Group

texts.en:
With hard work and high self esteem traits, M. Joshua (aged 52 years) has tried beyond any limits to maintain his general merchandise retail shop. He has been operating his shop for over 10 years from Bugalya trading centre, after abandoning his former farming enterprise. Being one of the most active businesses here in Uganda, many business entrepreneurs have tried to invest in general merchandise retail shops as they normally cut across all domestic appliances. Joshua is among the lucky ones benefitting from operating this type of store. 

With this loan, he hopes to be able to purchase more stock for his business, as his drawback has been in having little capital input. He also hopes to be in a position to transform the business into a wholesale one to improve his income. This will make him live up to his goals of educating his children and building a home for himself. 

He belongs to a group with other members who insure and hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of home products especially utensils for resale

loans.name: F. Comfort

texts.en: Madame Comfort A. is 40 years old and lives in Lome, Togo with her husband and two children. Since 1990 she has been working at the Hedzranawoe Market in Lome selling used clothing. She is now requesting her first loan from WAGES of 500,000 CFA in order to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing

loans.name: Esperanza De Jesus

texts.es: Esperanza De Jesús tiene 59 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio en un quiosco hace mas de 4 años que tiene esta negocio, ya que anteriormente se levantaba temprano y salía a recorrer las calles a vender todo tipo de frutas, pues así con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado salir adelante fue así que logro establecer un local en el colegio covisua, pues aquí es donde ella ofrece los diferentes productos a sus pequeños clientes. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos naturales, frutas, pan jugos y galletas. Sueña con seguir con su negocio en el colegio y agrandar su inventario.
texts.en:
Esperanza De Jesús is 59 years old, and she owns a kiosk offering food that she has been running for 4 years: prior to this, she used to wake up very early and walk through the streets to sell various kinds of fruit. This is how, in time, she has succeeded in getting ahead and in opening a shop in a school of the Covisua suburb, where she offers different products to her young customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy core materials such as sweets, natural soft drinks, fruit, bread, juice and biscuits. She dreams of continuing with this activity in the school and of boosting her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different products.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Sra. Lorena tiene su domicilio en la localidad de el torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  en el Barrio Villa Norte, tiene un hijo de un año, su esposo es funcionario publico en la Honorable  Alcaldía Municipal, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante, vive en casa en anticrético, esta juntando dinero para construir su propia vivienda;  el destino del crédito es para construir una pequeña tienda para la venta de sus productos y necesita comprar pintura, material y también muebles para exponer sus productos, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas ya que trabaja con la institución hace mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Lorena lives in the Villa Norte neighborhood of El Torno, which is 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. She has a one year old child. Her husband is a public official in the municipal mayor’s office. Her business is selling cosmetics in an itinerant manner. She lives in “anticrético” (a special type of rental agreement in Bolivia). She is getting together money to build her own house. The loan is to build a small store to sell her products. She also needs to buy paint, material, and furniture to display her products. She is a hard-working person. She is responsible with her payments, and she has worked with the institution for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a sales stand

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a brindar servicio de tipeos, impresiones y escaneados en su vivienda, para realizar su trabajo cuenta con una computadora equipada, esta actividad cuenta con bastante acogida en la ciudad ya que en ella se encuentra instalada la universidad más grande de la región y los estudiantes siempre requieren de estos servicios para poder realizar de mejor modo sus labores.

Julio realiza sus trabajos de modo responsable y trata en lo posible de brindar un buen servicio, por estas razones ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre acuden a el cuando necesitan que les tipeen algún trabajo o cuando necesitan imprimirlo. Con los ingresos que el obtiene de esta actividad solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a sus padres a solventar la economía del hogar.

El continuo uso brindado a sus máquinas ha hecho que estas empiecen a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, además Julio desea adquirir algunos útiles de oficina con los cuales pueda implementar su negocio, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.

Julio es un joven trabajador y responsable, en la zona donde viven sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima y le consideran alguien confiable.
texts.en:
Julio, age 28, is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Lambayeque. It is an area with plenty of commercial activity, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For three years he has been providing typing, printing, and scanning services in his house. To do his work he has a fully equipped computer. This activity is well received in the city because the largest university in the area is located there. The students always need these services to be able to do their work in the best way. Julio works in a responsible way. He does whatever he can to offer good service. That is why he now has a group of loyal customers. They always go to him when they need their work typed or when they need to print it. With the income he gets from this activity he pays for his personal expenses and helps his parents with the household finances. The continual use of his machines has caused them to start having some problems, which require urgent repair in order to guarantee that they work correctly. Also, Julio wants to get some office supplies, which he can use in his business. That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan for 1,000 soles. The loan will help him achieve his objective. Julio is a hard-working and responsible young man. In the area where he lives his neighbors and his customers hold him in high esteem and consider him to be trustworthy. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer maintenance and office supplies to improve his typing and scanning business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: The Fiske Five Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel F., shown holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called The F. Five. A 28-year-old married father of three children who range in age from three to seven, Emmanuel was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty.

For the past year he has been selling phone cards in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia, and plans to use his 5,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more phone cards. Describing himself as an intelligent person, Emmanuel's dream is to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards

loans.name: Kabweeza Intergrated Development A, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Second-hand clothes are in high favour with many people in Uganda. Not one to be left out of this lucrative opportunity presenting itself in his home area of Kyakato, Mubende, Emmanuel B., a hardworking, dependable and lively 52-year-old, made a decision to capitalize on it. With the money he saved conducting his other businesses, he bought his first consignment bales of used clothing.

Despite fluctuations in his business fortunes, Emmanuel's resilience has enabled him to make enormous headway, reflected by the fact that he earns 150,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. A man who likes taking a long view, he has drawn up a plan to expand his second-hand clothing business into a big franchise. With this loan, Emmanuel is optimistic he will be empowered financially to realize his dream as he anticipates fully educating all of his children and building a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes for his business

loans.name: Angel Alexis

texts.es:
Angel Alexis A. A.  tiene 26 años. Es soltero vive con la mama,  no tiene  hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Angel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Angel dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y crianza de cerdos. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos y para la compra animales. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima y las enfermedades.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Angel Alexis A. A. is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his mother. He does not have any children. He lives in the village of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Angel is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates on the whole, that in the majority are dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that they have requested from the San José Cooperative. Angel is dedicated to agriculture, sowing corn and breeding hogs. He carries out his purchases each month in Bucay and sells his products in the same location. He requests the loan to invest in seeds for his cultivations and to purchase animals. He thinks that the credit is an opportunity to do well. His dreams are to have money for the purchase of a house. He faces challenges such as the climate and diseases. He likes sports.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow and animals to raise

loans.name: Fresas ( Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Vitalina Pérez P., es originaria de Copainala Estado de Chiapas, México. Tiene 69 años de edad, está casada con el señor: José Pérez Rodríguez. En el cual tuvieron ocho hijos quien cada uno está casado. Ella tiene a su cargo a seis nietos de una hija que trabaja fuera de su pueblo.

 Vitalina, se dedica a comprar y vender productos de la región como son: puntas de chayote, frijol, durazno, entre otros. Y  tiene practicando esta actividad desde hace nueve años y ocho meses, el cual nos comenta  le ha ido muy bien desde que inicio esta actividad y la ha sacado de problemas, aunque tiene  que salir de su pueblo para vender su producto.

 Comenta que su inspiración por esta actividad es para obtener ganancias y aportar en los gastos de la casa, ya que su esposo ya no puede realizar las actividades en el campo por su estado de salud. De esa manera trabaja para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.

 Con las ganancias piensa ahorrar para comprar más producto de la región y siga trabajando el préstamo que fundación realidad le otorga hasta que Dios le preste vida.

Ella es representante del grupo que solicitó el préstamo a FRAC por la invitación de una de las coordinadoras quien frecuentemente la visitaba y la animó a participar, el grupo se llama “Fresas” la razón del nombre es porque en ese lugar se cosecha esta fruta.

 Las personas que integran este grupo son:

 Isabel Muñoz García: se dedica a vender antojitos.
 Teresa de Jesús Pérez Pérez: vende antojitos.
 María Nelly Pérez P.: se dedica a vender carnes.
 Vitalina Pérez P.: es la persona que se tomó la entrevista y vende productos de la región.
texts.en:
Vitalina Pérez P. is from Copainala in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is 69 years old, and she is married to José Pérez Rodríguez. They have eight children, and each one of them is married. She has eight grandchildren under her care because their mother, who is one of her daughters, works outside of their town. Vitalina buys and sells regional products like “chayote” (a type of squash) shoots, beans, and peaches among others. She has been doing this activity for nine years and eight months. She tells us that it has gone very well for her since she started, even though she has to leave her town to be able to sell her product. Her business has solved her problems. She comments that she was inspired to do this work to get earnings and to contribute to the household expenses. Her husband cannot do field work because of his health. She works to cover the household expenses. With her earnings she plans to save to buy more regional products. She will continue working with the loan from Fundación Realidad as long as God gives her life. She represents the group that requested the loan from FRAC. She joined because she was invited by one of the coordinators who frequently visited her and encouraged her to participate. The group is called “Fresas” (Strawberries) because this fruit is grown in the area. The people who comprise this group are: Isabel Muñoz García: Sells snacks Teresa de Jesús Pérez Pérez: Sells snacks María Nelly Pérez P.: Sells meat Vitalina Pérez P.: The person who was interviewed; she sells regional products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The products sold at the market like beans, peaches, and chayote roots, among other things

loans.name: Avenir Plus Group

texts.en:
Jennifer B. is the chairwoman of this community bank named “Avenir Plus”, which is composed of sixteen micro-entrepreneurs. They are jointly united to receive loans from Kiva through HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Jennifer is 43 years old, married and has five children between the ages of 7 and 26 and all of them go to school.

Jennifer started her business in 2007 with capital of $50 selling doughnuts. Today, she operates a restaurant which has prospered thanks to HOPE DRC’s loans and her husband’s management support. With the profit of about $10 earned per day, she has increased her working capital. Her restaurant is located in the western area of Kinshasa.

Currently, Jennifer is happy to be part of one of HOPE DRC’s groups. She joined the group in August 2009 and her business has been reinforced through the three loans she received from HOPE DRC which she repaid properly. Her dream is to open a catering service.

loans.use: To reinforce her working capital and increase the inventory of her restaurant

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jorge Ignacio

texts.es:
Jorge Ignacio  P. R. tiene 78 años. Es viudo vive  solo,  no tiene  hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Jorge es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jorge dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima y las enfermedades.

Le gusta hacer podas en los huertos de cacao.
texts.en:
Jorge Ignacio P. R. is 78 years old. He is a widower and lives alone. He does not have any children. He lives in the village of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Jorge is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates on the whole, that in the majority are dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that he has requested from the San José Cooperative. Jorge is dedicated to agriculture, sowing corn and cocoa. He carries out his purchases each month in Bucay and sells his produce in the same location. He requests the loan to invest in seeds for his cultivations. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to do well. His dreams are to have money for the purchase of a house. He faces challenges such as the climate and diseases. He likes to prune the cocoa orchards.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Kabweeza Intergrated Development B, Mubende Group

texts.en:
In the village of Kabweeza, Mubende town, lives K. Grace, a determined lady aged 44 years. She is a go-getter businesswoman who ownes a retail shop dealing in general merchandise. This stickler for hard work, and widowed mother of three school-going children, has basked in the checkered career graces of her business for the last ten years.

With this experience behind her, Grace has managed to subdue most of the uncertain adversities that have threatened to play havoc with her business. What has played into her hands as she operates her business has been her exceptional customer relationship skills. In a month, her business generates her a profit of 200,000 Ugandan shillings. This, to all intents and purposes, is a low figure. 

As it is now, Grace is taking a long view with the aim of maximizing her small profits. She figures this loan will significantly come in handy in helping her to buy more stock.

loans.use: To buy more stock of home utensils for her store

loans.name: Bidoutime

texts.en:
Madame Bidoutime K. is 35 years old and is single with one child. She sells potable water and juice in Lome, Togo.

Madame K. has been selling Pure Water, potable water sold in bags, and juice since 2008. She would like to expand her business and increase her clientele, so she is taking a loan of 120,000 CFA from WAGES in order to purchase more merchandise to sell. Hopefully this loan will help increase her profits to better provide for her child.

loans.use: To purchase more water and juice to sell

loans.name: Janeth Guadalupe

texts.es:
Janeth Guadalupe G. G. tiene 35 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  tiene 4  hijos, Jairo (17), Boris (16), Evelin (13) y Mishel (11), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Janeth es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Janeth dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para sus cultivos. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa. Enfrenta desafíos son el clima y las enfermedades.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Janeth Guadalupe G. G. is 35 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She has 4 children: Jairo (17), Boris (16), Evelin (13) and Mishel (11). She lives in the village fo Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Janeth is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates in all. The majority are dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that she has requested from the San José Cooperative. Janeth is dedicated to agriculture, sowing corn. She carries out her purchases each month in Bucay y sells her produce in the same location. She requests a loan to buy seeds for sowing. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to have money to buy a house. She faces challenges such as the weather and diseases. She likes to listen to music.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock his farm with more cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Emma Rosa

texts.es:
Emma Rosa L. M. tiene 36 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  tiene 3 hijos, Monica (16), Francisco (10) y Maria Jose  (9 meses), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Emma es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Emma dedica a la crianza de animales como son los pollos y los cerdos. Realiza sus compras a los tres meses en Bucay y las vende en la misma localidad en su casa

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en animales como pollos, cerdos y también cuyes. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa. Enfrenta desafíos  las enfermedades y la falta de dinero.

Le gusta realizar manualidades y pasar tiempo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emma Rosa L. M. is 36 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She has 3 children: Monica (16), Francisco (10) and Maria Jose (9 months). She lives in the village of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Emma is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates in all, the majority dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that she has requested from the San José cooperative. Emma is dedicated to breeding animals such as chickens and hogs. She carries out her purchases every three months in Bucay and sells her animals from her house. She requests the loan to invest in animals such as chickens, hogs and also guinea pigs. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity to do well. Her dreams are to have money for the purchase of a house. She faces challenges such as diseases and the lack of money. She likes to make handicrafts and to pass time with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs and guinea pigs to raise.

loans.name: Holali Anita

texts.en:
Madame Holali Anita Adjeoda is a young entrepreneur living in Lome, Togo. At 27 years old, she has a successful beauty salon called Holani Coiffure. Her specialty is hair and beauty for her clients. She has had her business since 2004.

In order to continue to grow her business and satisfy her customers, Holali would like to purchase more cosmetic products to sell. She gets these products over the border in Accra, Ghana. To this end she has taken a loan of 400,000 XOF in order to pay for the purchase and transportation of these items. Madame Adjeoda is married to a mechanic and they have one child.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: God Willing Group

texts.en:
Foday B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Willing.  He is 32 years old, single and has two children who are 3 and 6 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty.   

For 7 years, he has been selling vegetable oil, milk and rice in Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more vegetable oil, milk and rice.

He describes himself as an easy-going person. His dream is to improve his business and go back to school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable oil, milk and rice.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es: El Señor  Froilán es un cliente nuevo,  ha mostrando buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable y Cortez en la evaluación que se le hizo,  por esta razón se lo escogió para otorgarle el crédito kiva.  El cliente cuenta con un snack (cafetería - pastelería), que esta ubicado en la zona de la 16 de julio av. Juan pablo II, empieza su labor a las 9:00 am y la termina a las 21:00 aproximada mente, la esposa es quien prepara los pasteles, tortas y empanadas, el negocio es familiar ya que la hija mayor también ayuda en la atención (por las tardes). El mayor sueño de la familia es llegar a tener un buen patrimonio estable y que sus hijos lleguen a tener una carrera profesional, por lo que se esfuerzan en lograrlo día a día.
texts.en:
Froilán is a new client. He has demonstrated the willingness to pay, and he was friendly and polite during the evaluation. That is why he was selected for a Kiva loan. He has a snack business (cafeteria – bakery), which is located in the area of 16 de Julio avenue and Juan Pablo II. He starts his work at 9:00 a.m. and finishes at approximately 9:00 p.m. His wife makes the pastries, cakes, and empanadas. It is a family business. His daughter helps wait on customers (in the afternoons). The families’ greatest dream is to have a good, stable financial situation, and that the children come to have a professional career. They work very hard everyday to achieve their dream.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair equipment and fix up snack stand

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Maria Ines C. R. tiene 32 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  tiene 2 hijos, Javier (11) y Joel  (18),  vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Maria dedica a la agricultura, siembra cacao, naranja, piña. Realiza sus compras cada tres meses en Matilde Esther y los productos los vende en la localidad de la comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas de cacao, naranja, piña. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa. Enfrenta desafíos  las enfermedades y la falta de dinero.

Le gusta mucho bailar.
texts.en:
Maria Ines C. R. is 32 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She has 2 children: Javier (11) and Joel (18). She lives in the village of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Maria is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates in all, the majority dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that she has requested from the San José cooperative. Maria is dedicated to agriculture, sowing cocoa, oranges and pineapple. She makes her purchases every 3 months in Matilde Esther and sells her products in the local community. She requests a loan to buy seeds for cocoa, oranges and pineapple. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to have the money to purchase a house. She faces challenges such as diseases and the lack of money. She likes to dance a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for cocoa, oranges and pineapple.

loans.name: Blanca Teresa

texts.es:
Blanca Teresa M. L. tiene 45 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  tiene 2 hijos, Cristian  (11) y Heidi (18),  vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Blanca es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Blanca tiene una tienda de abarrotes y un bazar en donde vende cosméticos de yambal Realiza sus compras cada tres meses en Matilde Esther y los productos los vende en la localidad de la comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la tienda y para traer cosas para su bazar. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa y ser directoria de yambal. Enfrenta desafíos  las enfermedades y la falta de dinero.

Le gusta mucho bailar.
texts.en:
Blanca Teresa M. L. is 45 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband and children. She has 2 children: Cristian (11) and Heidi (18). She lives in the village of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Blanca is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates in all, the majority dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that she has requested from the San José cooperative. Blanca has a convenience store and a bazaar where she sells Yanbal cosmetics. She carries out her purchases every three months in Matilde Esther and sells her products in the local community. She requests the loan to invest in the store and merchandise for her bazaar. She thinks that the credit is an opportunity to do well. Her dreams are to have money for the purchase of a house and to be director of Yanbal. she faces challenges such as illnesses and the lack of money. She likes to dance a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and bazaar.

loans.name: Gotitas De Cristal Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “GOTITAS DE CRISTAL”, esta solicitando  crédito por primera vez, es parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho personas, tienen a la cabeza de la asociación una mesa directiva compuesta por la presidenta la señora Lourdes L. N., la secretaria de actas Sofía Q. y la tesorera Julia M.. 

La señora Sofía Q..  Tiene como negocio la venta de helados, desde hace seis meses en las ferias, los días lunes, miércoles y jueves.  Su padre fue quién le ayudó a incursionar en este negocio.

Este primer crédito es por Bs.1500.-, ella indica que le servirá para la compra de un carrito para la venta de helados.
 
Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal “Gotitas de Cristal”, tienen diversos negocios, como: venta de helados, venta de comida, confección de polleras, venta de cosméticos, venta de polleras y mantas a medio uso, venta de ollas, tienda y atención de teléfono público.
texts.en:
The “Gotitas De Cristal” (Little Crystal Drops) Communal Bank is requesting a loan for the first time. It is part of the German Busch Community Center. It is comprised of eight people. The head of the bank is a board of directors comprised of the president, Lourdes Luta N.; the secretary, Sofía Q.; and the treasurer, Julia M.. Mrs. Q. has had a business selling ice cream for six months. She sells at fairs on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Her father was the one who helped her get into this business. This first loan is for 1,500 BOB. She says that she will use it to buy a cart for selling ice cream. The members of the Gotitas de Cristal Communal Bank have different businesses like selling ice cream, selling food, making “polleras” (traditional skirts) and semi-used blankets, selling pots, a store, and public telephone service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cart for selling ice cream

loans.name: Lucrecia Clementina

texts.es: Lucrecia Clementina tiene 49 años, tiene 2 hijos sus hijos menores de edad están a su cargo,  ella se levanta temprano para realizar su trabajo  que es la venta de refrescos naturales, chancho con yuca, artículos desechables y bolsas plásticas,  ya que también tiene que realizar los quehaceres del hogar, desde hace mas de 11 años que tiene este negocio,  se encuentra muy contenta con los financiamientos pues no es la primera vez, es por eso que siempre está pensando en mejorar cada día más. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de vasos, cucharas, platos, bolsas, frescos, golosinas yuca y chancho.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Clementina is 49 years old, and she has two minor children under her care. She gets up early to do her work, which is selling natural soft drinks, pork with “yuca” (root grown as a staple food, eaten fried or boiled) disposable items, and plastic bags. She also has to do the household chores. She has had this business for over 11 years. She is very happy with the loans; it is not the first one. That is why she is always thinking about improving more each day. She will use the requested loan to buy glasses, spoons, plates, bags, soft drinks, sweets, yuca and pork.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Karimatou

texts.en:
Madame Karimatou A. A. is 40 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. She has a general store where she sells lots of different products, such as soap, petrol, foodstuffs and cereals. She has been in business since 2003.

Madame A. would like to purchase more merchandise for her store, and to this end she has taken a loan of 400,000 XOF to purchase more products from the Grand Market in Lome. Madame A. is married and they have two children.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the general store

loans.name: Anibal Jose

texts.es:
Anibal Jose M. L. tiene 42 años. Es casado vive con el esposa y con los hijos,  tiene 3 hijos, Mónica (16), Francisco (10) y Maria Jose  (9 meses), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
 
Anibal es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Anibal se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales como son pollos y cerdos Realiza sus compras cada tres meses en Matilde Esther y los productos los vende en la localidad de la comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales para incrementar la producción y cumplir su sueño. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra de una casa. Enfrenta desafíos  las enfermedades.

Le gusta la agricultura y cría a sus animales.
texts.en:
Anibal Jose M. L. is 42 years of age. He is married and lives with his wife and children. He has 3 children: Mónica (16), Francisco (10) y Maria Jose (9 months). He lives in the village of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. Anibal is an associate of the 'King of Kings' rural branch, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 associates in all, the majority dedicated to agriculture. This is the first loan that he has requested from the San José cooperative Anibal is dedicated to breeding animals such as chickens and hogs. He carries out his purchases every three months in Matilde Esther and sells his animals in the local community. He requests a loan to purchase more animals in order to increase his production and realize his dream. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have the money to purchase a house. He faces challenges such as diseases. He likes agriculture and raising his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animals to raise

loans.name: Bolivia Natividad

texts.es:
Bolivia Natividad R. M. tiene 37 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  tiene 3 hijos, Leonela (12), Cristina (10) y Jorge  (11), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Bolivia es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Bolivia se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, naranja, piña y yuca Realiza sus compras cada seis  meses en Matilde Esther y los productos los vende en la localidad de la comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de cacao, naranja, piña y yuca. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra incrementar su negocio comprarse una casa y dar la educación a los hijos. Enfrenta desafíos  las enfermedades.

Le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Bolivia Natividad R. M. is 37 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children: Leonela (12), Cristina (10) and Jorge (11). She lives in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

Bolivia is a member of the Rey de Reyes rural communal bank, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are taking out with Cooperativa San José.

Bolivia works in agriculture planting cacao, oranges, pineapple, and yucca. She makes her purchases every six months in Matilde Esther and she sells her products in the community.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of cacao, orange, pineapple, and yucca seeds. She feels that the loan is a way of getting ahead. Her dream is to have money for shopping, to expand her business, purchase a house, and provide her children with an education. The challenges that she faces are diseases.

She likes to dance.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of cacao, orange, pineapple, and yucca seeds.

loans.name: Marlon Javier

texts.es:
Marlon Javier V. M. tiene26años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos,  tiene 2 hijos, Elkim (3) y Marlon  (1 mes), vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Marlon es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Marlon  se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, naranja y yuca Realiza sus compras cada seis  meses en Matilde Esther y los productos los vende en la localidad de la comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de cacao, naranja y yuca. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra incrementar su negocio comprarse una casa y dar la educación a los hijos. Enfrenta desafíos  las enfermedades.

Le gusta criar pollos.
texts.en:
Marlon Javier V. M. is 26 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two children: Elkim (3) and Marlon (1 month). He lives in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

Marlon is a member of the Rey de Reyes rural communal bank, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are taking out with Cooperativa San José.

Marlon works in agriculture planting cacao, oranges, and yucca. He makes his purchases every six months in Matilde Esther and he sells his products in the community.

He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of cacao, orange, and yucca seeds. He feels that the loan is a way of getting ahead. His dream is to have money for shopping, to expand his business, purchase a house, and provide his children with an education. The challenges that he faces are diseases.

He likes to raise chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of cacao, orange, and yucca seeds.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim J. is a 41-year-old businessman; he is married and has six children, 3 boys and 3 girls.  Four of these children are in primary school, and the other two are in secondary school.

Ibrahim has his business in the Krootown community, which is in the western business district. Ibrahim has a tea shop and also sells other items including provisions. He also owns a bakery where he produces bread for the Krootown community. Ibrahim has been producing bread for this community for the past 15 years and in the process has gained a lot of loyal customers.
