Ibrahim produces quality bread and as a result he has attracted the attention of customers from other communities.

He has been receiving loans from ARD and has a very good loan history. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones to expand his shop and to produce more bread to meet the demand of his customers.

Ibrahim intends using the proceeds from this loan to help educate his children and provide food for his family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of bread flour and provisions

loans.name: Natividad Emperatriz

texts.es:
Natividad Emperatriz M. L. tiene 48 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  tiene 5 hijos, Fernando, Roxana, Mariana, Hernán y Jahaira vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
 
Natividad  es una socia de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Natividad se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Realiza sus compras cada seis  meses en Matilde Esther y los productos los vende en la localidad de la comunidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para la compra incrementar su negocio comprarse una casa y dar la educación a los hijos. Enfrenta desafíos  las enfermedades.

Le gusta criar pollos.
texts.en:
Natividad Emperatriz M. L. is 48 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and five children: Fernando, Roxana, Mariana, Hernán, and Jahaira. She lives in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

Natividad is a member of the Rey de Reyes rural communal bank, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. There are 23 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the first loan that they are taking out with Cooperativa San José.

Natividad works raising chickens. She makes her purchases every six months in Matilde Esther and she sells her products in the community.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of animals. She feels that the loan is a way of getting ahead. Her dream is to have money for shopping, to expand her business, purchase a house, and provide her children with an education. The challenges that she faces are diseases.

She likes to raise chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of animals.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Ramiro Prialé del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, este distrito es conocido por ser el de mayor población dentro de la región Lambayeque, es a la vez el distrito con mayores indices de pobreza, dado que su población se encuentra situada en zonas urbano – marginales. Se encuentra próximo a la ciudad de Chiclayo, a diez minutos de su plaza de armas.

Se dedica a la venta de verduras dentro del mercado mayorista Los Pathos, el distrito donde reside es también conocido por su abundante movimiento comercial, ya que allí se encuentran localizados los dos mercados mayoristas de la región. La jornada de José empieza desde muy temprano, el se dirige a comprar su mercadería a los distribuidores para luego ofrecerlas en venta a los comerciantes minoristas de los diversos mercados y bodegas de la ciudad. Los ingresos que le brinda este negocio le sirven para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia.

José desea mejorar la infraestructura del puesto donde ofrece su mercadería, ya que actualmente no cuenta con una buena estructura: el desea ponerle techo de calamina y realizar otros arreglos que le permitan conservar su verdura en mejores condiciones, para ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona amable y que siempre trata de brindar una buena atención a sus clientes. Su negocio cuenta con buena acogida, su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio para poder seguir ayudando a sus padres.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old. He is single, and he lives with his parents in the Ramiro Prialé sector of the José Leonardo Ortiz district. This district is known for having the largest population in the Lambayeque district. It is also the district with the greatest poverty, given that the population is in marginally urban areas. It is next to the city of Chiclayo, which is ten minutes from the Plaza de Armas . He sells vegetables in the Los Pathos wholesale market. The district where he lives is also known for its abundant commercial activity. The two wholesale markets are located in the region. José’s work day starts very early. He goes to buy his merchandise from the distributors. He will later sell them to the retail merchants in different markets and grocery stores in the city. The income from this business pays for his personal expenses and helps his family. José wishes to improve the infrastructure of his stand where he sells his merchandise. The current infrastructure is not good. He wants to put up a tin roof and make other adjustments that will allow him to keep his vegetables in the best conditions. That is why his is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan for 1,000 soles, which will help him achieve his objective. José is a friendly person, and he always tries to give his customers good service. His business is well received, and his greatest desire is to expand his business in order to be able to keep helping his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses to improve the infrastructure of the stand where he sells wholesale vegetables

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Tomasa 22 años de edad reside en el Municipio de Lolotique, Departamento de Morazán, está acompañada, vive con el esposo y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, ella se dedica a la ven de pescado y Elaboración de Hamacas.
Se dedica al negocio de las hamacas hace un año el cual lo aprendió gracias a su madre, y también se dedica a la venta de pescado el cual lo compra en la Ciudad de San Miguel y lo comercializa en los alrededores de Lolotique, dos veces por semana, y el resto de los días se dedica a fabricar Hamacas. Solicita un préstamo para compra de materiales como son: hilo de seda de diferentes colores, compra de pescado.
Los sueños de Tomasa son adquirir un puesto en el mercado de Lolo tique, para venta de pescado, y mejorar las ventas, contribuir para mejorar el sistema de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 22 years old and lives in the municipality of Lolotique, in the Department of Morazán. She lives with her husband, and she has a 4-year-old child. Her work is selling fish and making hammocks. She has been working in the hammock business for a year. She learned the trade thanks to her mother, and she also sells fish, which she buys in the city of San Miguel and sells twice a week in the area surrounding Lolotique. On the other days, she works making hammocks. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as silk thread of various colors, and to buy fish. Tomasa's dreams are to acquire a market stall in Lolotique to sell her fish, to improve her sales, and to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies to make hammocks, such as silk thread in various colors, and buying fish

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas S. C.  es un señor de 62 años de edad que vive con su esposa en una comunidad llamada la Palma de Puerto Jiménez en la provincia de Puntarenas. Durante muchos años su población se dedico a la minería de oro y la explotación Forestal y la Agricultura,  hasta que se creó el parque Nacional Corcovado,  que en conjunto con sus hermosas playas han abierto el paso a la industria turística siendo hoy la más importante de la zona. 
Don Lucas trabajó por muchos años en las minas de oro de Puerto Jimenez. Ahora su vida gira en torno a la agricultura produciendo todo tipo de hortalizas tales como arroz, maíz, cacao, plátano. El vende sus productos en el mercado de Campesinos a muy buen precio lo que le permite mantener a su familia y llevar una buena calidad de Vida.
Para seguir con su producción Don Lucas necesita un crédito de ¢600 000 (seiscientos mil colones)para comprar abono y semillas para la siembra de maíz. Asegura que este crédito le servirá de mucho ya que los precios de estos insumos han aumentado mucho,  y que en 3 meses  ya tendrá las ganancias  para pagar su préstamo.
Don Lucas  es socio de Raíces Capitales S.A, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con el espera tener una gran cosecha de maíz este año para seguir como microempresario Agricultor.
texts.en:
Lucas S. C. is 62 years old. He lives with his wife in a community called La Palma de Puerto Jiménez in the Puntarenas province. For many years the population has devoted itself to gold mining, lumber, and farming. The Nacional Corcovado Park was created, which together with the beautiful beaches opened the door to the tourist trade. It is now the most important community in the area. Lucas worked in the Puerto Jimenez gold mines for many years. Now his life revolves around farming. He produces all types of crops such as rice, corn, cacao, and bananas. He sells his products in the Campesinos market. He sells for a very good price, which allows him to support his family and have a good quality of life. In order to continue with his production, Lucas needs a loan for 600,000 colones to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant corn. He is sure that this loan will help a lot because the prices of these supplies have greatly increased. In three months he will have the earnings to pay for the loan. Lucas is a member of the Raíces Capitales S.A,. one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan. He expects to have a great corn harvest this year in order to continue as a small businessman in farming.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and corn seeds

loans.name: Leonor Indiana

texts.es:
Leonor Indiana es una mujer activa de 64 años de edad, desde hace años logro poner su propio negocio un pequeño comedor que ha logrado hacer crecer con los años.
Procreo dos hijos los cuales la apoyan con el negocio, entre las dificultades es que son días variados, unos días se venden mas y otros poco, pero es un negocio que no se deja de vender.
Con este financiamiento lograra aumentar la inversión de alimentos para su comedor, en donde comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, harina, frutas y verduras, carnes, pollo en cantidades para la preparación diaria del menú.
A través de estos años, ha logrado la clientela, lo que se siente sastifecha de poder conservar su negocio.  Que es su fuente de ingreso para subsistir.
texts.en:
Leonor Indiana is an active, 64-year-old woman. Years ago she managed to start her own business, a small dining room, that she has managed to grow over the years. She has two children which she supports with the business. Among the difficulties she faces are that some days she sells more and other days she sells little. But it is a business where she can not stop selling. With this credit she will manage to buy more food for her dining room, such as rice, beans, sugar, flour, fruits and vegetables, meats, and chicken in quantities for the daily preparation of the menu. Through the years, she has attracted a growing clientele. She feels satisfied to be able to preserve her business, which is her source of income to subsist.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for the preparation of dishes for her restaurant

loans.name: Basilia Cruz

texts.es:
Basilia Cruz C. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada, emprendedora y luchadora quien inicio hace dos años vendiendo chiverías y gaseosas actualmente tiene una pequeña pulpería donde comercializa granos básico, huevos, jabones, detergentes etc. 
Ella con el crédito piensa mejorar su negocio surtiéndolo con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Basilia Cruz C. is a hard-working, dedicated, entrepreneurial, and tenacious woman who started selling snacks and soft drinks two years ago. She currently has a small store where sells basic grains, eggs, soap, and detergent, etc. She plans to use the loan to improve her business by stocking it with a greater quantity and variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic grains, snacks, and cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Rita Anielka

texts.es: Rita Anielka tiene 27 años, su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, por lo que se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para iniciar sus labores del hogar y empezar con la elaboración de tortillas, pues sus inicios se dieron con la intención de buscar nuevos ingresos, por lo que no tenía un empleo para seguir adelante y necesitaba generar ingresos. Es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento y se encuentra contenta. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de maíz, cal, leña y tortillas. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
Rita Anielka is 27 years old. Her economic activity is selling tortillas. She has had this business for over four years. She has 1 child and she gets up at 5 o'clock in the morning to do the housework and to start making the tortillas. She began the business seeking more income, since she didn't have a job and needed to make money. This is the first time that she has taken out a loan and she is happy. The loan will be used to buy corn, lime, and firewood. Her dream is to expand her busines and open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia Pérez Hernández es una señora de 38 años de edad, solamente con sus tres hijos ya que su esposo murió hace algunos años.  Ellos viven en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Cuatro Bocas de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche) y agricultura.
Doña Nidia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ropa y perfumes y otros artículos personales casa por casa. Sus hijos le ayudan ocasionalmente con el transporte lo cual le facilita su trabajo.
Doña Nidia ha solicitado un microcrédito por un monto de ¢380.000 (Trescientos ochenta mil colones ) para comprar y vender mercadería en su Comunidad. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando ella espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
Ella es  socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bansuperafe; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su priemr  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Nidia Pérez Hernández is a 38 year old woman raising her three children alone since her husband died some years ago. They live in a small rural community of Costa Rica called Cuatro Bocas de Upala, located in the province of Alajuela. The economic activities there are commerce, dual purpose cattle (beef and dairy), and agricultural. Nidia sells cosmetics, clothing, perfume and personal items from door to door. Her children help her occasionally with transportation, which facilitates her work. Nidia has asked for a microloan in the ammont of ¢380.000 (three hundred and eighty thousand colones) to buy and sell merchandise in her community. Her business is going well but she hasn't been able to grow it more due to a lack of money. With the loan that she is asking for she hopes to improve her family's financial condition. She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bansuperafe. It is made up only of women, since it specializes in supporting women who do not have professions and who are heads of households. It is one of 100 EDESA member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be her fist loan and with it she hopes to continue growing personally and financially as well as participate actively in the credit organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cosmetics and household items.

loans.name: Damasco Group

texts.es:
El grupo damasco está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ivania del Carmen Dávila desde hace cinco años de lunes a domingo tiene una pequeña fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita, los fines de semana realiza nacatamales y comercializa ropa por encargo.
Las otras integrantes son Claudia  R. comerciante de ropa y Emerita M. quien desde hace 10 años vende ropa de todo tipo. Ellas invertirán el crédito en la compra de mercadería especialmente por las hípicas y microfer.
texts.en:
The "Damasco" group is made up of 3 enterprising, dedicated and hardworking women. One of these is Ivania del Carmen Dávila, who has had a small restaurant for 5 years, where she sells fried food every day. On the weekends she also makes nacatamales (a special type of large tamale typical of Nicaragua) and sells clothing via advance orders. The other members are Claudia R., who sells clothing, and Emerita M., who has been selling all types of clothing for 10 years. They will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise, particularly for the horse parades and art festivals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy meat, staple grains, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Foussena

texts.en:
Madame Foussena I. is 32 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. She is married to a merchant and they have two children. Madame I. has been selling pagnes, a traditional Togolese wax-printed cloth, and baby clothing since 2000. She usually sells these items by loading them into a basket and carrying it with her on her head throughout her neighborhood. 

She would like to diversify her selection a bit and for this she has requested a loan of 200,000 Central African CFA francs in order to purchase more panges and baby clothing. With her increased profits she hopes to reinvest in her business and better provide for her children.

loans.use: To purchase pagnes [traditional Togolese fabrics] and baby outfits

loans.name: Patachaj Group

texts.es: Doña Paulina, es una persona Casada, curso el segundo  grado de primaria, tiene dos  hijos los cuales Uno de ellos es de  diez años de edad y el otro de cinco años, ella se dedica al Comercio , (Compra  y venta de Ropa Tipica), tiene 10 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario se  denomina Patachaj, el nombré indica la aldea donde  residen estas personas  y su ubicación. El grupo cuenta con cuatro  integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, Comercio,   venta de verduras y frutas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de mercadería (Ropa Típica) y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Doña paulina es la dueña del negocio, por los que necesitar invertira mas capital, y espera que su negocio sea más grande y competitivo.
texts.en:
Paulina is married and completed the second year of primary school. She has 2 children, one of whom is 10 years old and the other is 5 years old. She has had a business buying and selling traditional Guatemalan clothing for 10 years. With enthusiasm and the help of some neighbors, they organized a group so that they could apply for a loan. This communal bank is called "Patachaj;" the name comes from the town where the members live and where the group meets. This group contains 4 female members, who specialize in different activities, including raising animals, retail trade, and the sale of fruit and vegetables. They will use this loan to buy merchandise (typical clothing) and in this way increase the volume of their sales. Paulina is the owner of the business; she needs to invest more capital, and she hopes that her business will become bigger and more competitive.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital (to buy traditional Guatemalan clothing)

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una mujer trabajadora, que con mucho esfuerzo ha salido a delante tiene 46 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos estudiantes.
Su esposo trabaja en seguridad, el cual gana poco.
Es por eso ella toma la iniciativa de poder apoyar a su familia y con poco dinero de ahorro, comienza a comprar cerdo, el cual destaza y vende carne, como su manteca, lo que comienza a captar cliente.
Las dificultades es que tenía que esperar recoger todo el dinero para comprar más cerdo.
Lo que comienza a buscar fondos para lograr invertir en su pequeño negocio. La mejor opción era el financiamiento que logra, comenzar.
Con este préstamo comprara tres cerdos mas, ya qué ahora destaza dos o tres veces a la semana. Y mueve más su capital, a si como sus ganancias para lograr cubrir las necesidades personales, como gastos básicos de agua y luz.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a hard-working woman, who has moved ahead with a lot of effort . She is 46 years of age, married, with three children who are students. Her husband works in security, from which he earns little. For this reason, she has taken the initiative to help support her family and, with a little of her savings, she began to buy hogs, which she butchers and then sells the meat, such as bacon. The business has begun to draw customers. The difficulty is that she has to wait to collect all the money to buy another hog. She has begun to seek funds to invest in her small business. The best option was the financing that she has obtained. With this loan she bought three more hogs. She is already butchering two or three hogs a week. And her capital is quickly used up, just as her profits are used up to cover personal needs, like basic expenses for water and light.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three hogs to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Marjorie Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marjorie es una joven, trabajadora esforzada en esta vida, con deseo de poder tener una casa digna para sus dos hijos,  con ayuda de su esposo han logrado hacer su pequeña casa, que aun falta mucho por hacer, pero no cuenta con dinero en efectivo.
Es por eso decide trabajar de lavado y planchado toda la semana y poder obtener ingresos propios que ayude a los gastos, de alimentación, educación, medicina, u otros para lograr el equilibrio.
Con su primer préstamo logro terminar de cerrar su casa de concreto, ahora con este financiamiento, comprara: nueve láminas de zinc, golosos para cambiar parte del techo y cerrar la parte que le hace falta. Logrando con esto una mejora más en su casa, y un bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Marjorie is a young woman, hard-working and accomplished in this life, with the desire to be able to have a worthy house for her two children. With the aid of her husband, she has managed to make a small house, which still needs a lot of work, but they lack the money. Because of this she decided to work taking in washing and ironing all week in order to obtain her own income that helps with the expenses of food, education, medicine, and other things to achieve a balance. With her first loan she finished closing in her concrete house. Now, with this loan she will buy nine sheets of zinc, metal braces and screws to change part of the ceiling and to close the part that is missing. With this she will improve her house and the welfare of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets of zinc, metal braces and screws to close up the ceiling so the family will not get wet when it rains.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba B. sells palm oil and cassava at Elmina.  Aba has not received any form of education. She is married and has 10 dependants. Her husband is a steel bender. She helps her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava and oil for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her trade to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more cassava and oil for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama D. buys fresh fish from the fishermen at the seashore and smokes it for sale at Elmina.  Ama has no educational background. She is a widow and takes care of seven children. Ama has been in this fish business for some time now. She wishes to use the loan to purchase additional fresh fish to Process (smoke) and sell. She hopes to use the new revenues from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase additional fresh fish to process (smoke)

loans.name: Dondy

texts.fr:
Madame Dondy S. Habite dans la localité de Guediawaye. Elle est âgée  de 43 ans. Elle est veuve et mère  de 2 enfants. 
Dans le souci de mener ses propres activités  et disposer de revenus qui  l’aideront à gérer sa famille, madame S.  s’est orientée  dans le  commerce. Ainsi elle s’adonne à l’achat et la vente de mortiers, d’objets d’art et de  tissus au marche Serigne Mansour de Guediawaye. 
Madame S. est sociétaire  de la caisse depuis 2003 et a déjà  rembourse 3 prêts  antérieurs.
Elle emprunte 300 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de tissus, thioup, bois et masques destines a la vente. Son objectif est de répondre à la demande  et  satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle. En même  temps elle souhaite accroitre ses bénéfices  pour mieux gérer  sa famille car ses enfants comptent sur elle pour vivre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dondy S. lives in Guediawaye. She is 43-years old, a widow and mother of two children. In order to manage her own activities and earn income that will enable her to take care of her family, Mrs. S. became involved in trade. She buys and sells mortar, artwork and fabrics at the Serigne Mansour market of Guediawaye. Mrs. S. has been a member of the credit union since 2003, and she has already received and repaid three previous loans. She is now seeking a loan of 300,000F CFA to purchase fabrics, thioup (a hand-dyed fabric), wood and masks for resale. Her goal is to meet customer demand and fulfill the needs of her clientele. She would also like to increase her profits to better provide for her family, as her children are dependent on her.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. prepares banku at Elmina for sale.  Araba has not received any form of education.  She is married and has seven dependants. Her husband is a fisherman. She is responsible for helping her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more corn to cook banku and also to sell some of the raw corn to customers. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy more corn to cook banku to sell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, gracias a su desempeño como docente ha logrado  apoyar a su familia.
Con ahorros han logrado  hacer su casa, con lo caro que esta toda, ahora con la iniciativa del financiamiento han mejorado la infraestructura de su casa.
Con el préstamo anterior logro hacer la cocina, que hoy en día esta en mejores condiciones de espacio. 
Como trabajadora activa lo que desea es poder preservar su trabajo, para lograr el objetivo de seguir haciendo las mejoras  a su casa.
Con este préstamo seria su segundo financiamiento que podrá comprar puerta y ventana que están malas y quiere mejor seguridad en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sabina is a 45 year-old woman, married and the mother of 3 children. Thanks to her work as a teacher, she has managed to support her family. With her savings she has built her house, with the care that she gives to everything. Now, with the incentive of financing, she is improving the infrastructure of her house. With previous loans, she has added space to her kitchen. As an active worker she wants to preserve her job, in order to achieve the objective of continuing to improve her house. With this loan, her second, she will be able to buy a door and a window to replace damaged ones and improve the security of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a door and a window to replace ones damaged by age and thus improve the security of her home.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa A. is a widow who takes care of six dependents. She cooks rice at Elmina for sale and uses her income in providing the basic needs of her children.

Adjowa says the loan will enable her buy bags of rice instead of buying in small quantities. With the new returns from her expanded business, she plans to trade in other foods to bring variety into her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice instead of buying in small quantities

loans.name: Sabiétou

texts.en: Madame Sabiétou O. is 55 years old and lives in Lomé, Togo, where she sells charcoal and cereals from her home. Madame O. is married to a merchant and they have three children. Sabiétou has been engaged in this activity since 1995. Now she is seeking a loan of 500,000 CFA francs in order to purchase more charcoal and grains to sell from her home.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and cereals

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama B. sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), corn dough, soap, canned tomatoes and other foodstuffs at Elmina. She has no educational background. She is a widow taking care of two children and ensures the welfare of her children with the income she makes from her sales.

Ama’s loan, which is going to serve as additional capital, will be used to buy more of her foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her business.

loans.use: To serve as additional capital to buy more of her foodstuffs

loans.name: Bumbury (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Bumbury es un grupo conformado por cuatro amas de casa que se esfuerzan por ser mejores cada día. Rosalía se entero de Fundación Realidad por una vecina y le intereso tanto que se dio a la tarea de buscar a gente responsable para poder trabajar. Actualmente radican en la Comunidad de Chalco, Estado de México. Las integrantes del grupo son: Rosalía López Hernández (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo), María Esther V. Martínez (Venta de Pescado), Olga Lidia González Sánchez (Venta de Ropa) y Josefina López Hernández (Venta de Ropa).
 
Rosalía  de 28 años de edad es la representante del grupo (la de blusa morada), su familia la integran su esposo José y sus dos hijos quienes están en edad escolar. Desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos por catalogo ya que para ella lo primordial es tener una estabilidad económica para darles un buen futuro a su hijos. Rosalía ofrece su mercancía con sus vecinos y así ellos la recomiendan con sus amigos y familiares, se surte cada 15 días y dice que la mayoría de sus clientes son hombres, algo raro pero cierto. Sus fechas de mayor venta es cuando los niños regresan a clases y fechas especiales durante el año. El crédito solicitado lo ocupara para la compra de zapatos y con las ganancias que obtenga comprara útiles escolares y uniformes de sus hijos, ya que para ella es una buena inversión. Sus planes son poder construir su casa y así tener el espacio necesario para su familia.

Así como Rosalía las demás integrantes están muy contentas de haber formado su grupo y recibir el apoyo de Kiva a través de Fundación Realidad ya que así podrán comenzar a trabajar y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Bumbury is a group made up of 4 housewives who make an effort to improve themselves every day. Rosalia became aware of the Fundación Realidad through a neighbor, and it interested her so much that she dedicated herself to the task of looking for responsible people that she could work with. This group is located in the community of Chalco, in the state of Mexico. The members of the group are: Rosalía López Hernández (who sells shoes through a catalog), María Esther V. Martínez (who sells fish), Olga Lidia González Sánchez (who sells clothing) y Josefina López Hernández (who also sells clothing). Rosalia, 28, is the representative of the group (in the photo she is wearing the purple blouse.) Her family consists of her husband Jose and their 2 children who are school-aged. For 6 years she has been selling clothing and shoes through a catalog, since for her what is essential is to have economic stability so she can provide a good future to her children. Rosalia offers her merchandise to her neighbors, and they also recommend her to their friends and acquaintances. She gets her products every 15 days, and she says that the majority of her customers are men, which is unusual, but true. The times of the year she sells the most are when the children return to school and during holidays. The loan she requests will be used to buy shoes, and with the earning she obtains she will buy school supplies and school uniforms for her children, since for her this is a good investment. She plans to build her own house and in this way have the space she needs for her family. Rosalia and the other members are very happy to have formed their group and to receive support from Kiva through the Fundación Realidad, because this way they can start to work to accomplish their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing in general, and to buy fish and seafood

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba E. sells smoked fish, onions, pepper, rice and tomatoes at Elmina. She is a widow with no educational background. She has seven dependents and is responsible for the general welfare of her home.

Araba’s loan will be added to her existing capital to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profit that is going to accrue from her expanded business.

loans.use: To add to her existing capital to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua G. operates a provisions shop at Elmina. She has received junior high education. She is married and has eight dependents. Her husband is an accountant.

Efua has been selling provisions for some time now and supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to fill her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to fill her shop

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: El señor Rigoberto se encarga de un negocio de abarrotes, y pasa la mayor parte del día atendiéndolo. Su esposa tambien trabaja y al salir ella de su empleo le ayuda a su esposo a atender el negocio, son una pareja muy unida y se esfuerzan por tener un buen hogar. Ellos requieren de colocar una barda en la parte del frente de la vivienda, ya que como ellos no están prácticamente en todo el día, temen por la seguridad de su hogar, por que no cuentan con alguna protección. Es un matrimonio joven pero con muchas ganas de formar un patrimonio y tener una mejor calidad de vida para cuando lleguen los hijos que ya planean.
texts.en:
Rigoberto runs a grocery business and spends most of the day taking care of it. His wife also has a job and then helps her husband with the business once she has finished work. They are very united couple who work hard to have a good home. They need to put up a wall at the front of their house, because they are out for most of the day and they fear their home may not be safe because it is not protected. They are a young married couple who really wish to build up their wealth and have a better quality of life in time for the arrival of the children they are already planning to have.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The construction of a wall at the front of their house.

loans.name: Abrewa

texts.en:
Abrewa M. is married and has six dependents. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is a mason.

Abrewa sells secondhand towels and bedspreads at Elmina by moving from one area to another. She uses her income to support her husband in providing the basic needs of her family.

Abrewa will use the loan to purchase bales of secondhand goods for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a shop to display her goods in.

loans.use: To purchase bales of secondhand goods to sell

loans.name: Xecaxjoj Group

texts.es: Doña Juliana, es una persona Casada, curso el Sexto   grado de primaria, tiene tres   hijos los cuales Uno de ellos es de  seis  años de edad y el otro de cuatro cinco años y la otra niña es de 8 mese, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo en la manutención de sus hijos, ella se dedica a Agropecuario, (Crianza de animales domésticos), tiene 8 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario se  denomina Xecaxjoj, el nombré indica el paraje  donde  residen estas personas. El grupo es de 4 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a la actividad de crianza de animales vacunos, bovinos y porcinos, y la venta de los mismos en el mercado de la aldea de pasajoc, específicamente en el paraje Pologuá.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de animales  (Ganado, Porcino) y así incrementar el volumen de crianza de animales. Una de las dificultades de ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda de su esposo y espera que su producción sea más grande y competitiva.
texts.en:
Juliana is married, educated to the sixth grade of primary school, and has three children – the eldest two are six and five years old, and the youngest eight months old. Her husband helps her to support her children, and she has been breeding domestic animals for eight years. Thanks to the enthusiasm and help of some of her neighbours, they have formed a group to be able to request a loan. The communal bank is called Xecaxjoj, which is the name of the place where these people live. The group has four female members who rear cattle, sheep and pigs, and sell them at market in the village of Pasajoc, in Pologuá. Juliana will use the loan to buy animals (cattle and pigs), which will increase her animal-breeding capacity. One of the difficulties of being the owner of the business has been the lack of capital, but she has made progress with the help of her husband and hopes her production will become greater and more competitive.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en: Adowa Y. sells smoked fish and tomatoes at Elmina. To smoke her fish, she goes to the seashore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen. She comes home with the fish, cleans or dresses them and drains the water that comes about as a result of washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally made oven with firewood to smoke her fish.  Adowa has no educational background.  She is divorced and has seven dependants. Her loan will be used to buy more fish and tomatoes for resale. She hopes to reinvest back into her business should there be any form of increase as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fish and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive junto a su familia en el sector Atusparias del distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito con mayor población D. la región, considerado como el distrito con mayores indices D. pobreza, la mayor parte D. su población se encuentra situada en zonas urbano – marginales. Se encuentra ubicado próximo a la ciudad D. Chiclayo, a diez minutos D. su plaza D. armas.

Se dedica a la venta D. comida dentro del mercado D. su localidad, ella cuenta con un puesto dentro D. este centro D. abasto donD. ofrece a sus clientes diversos platos D. comida, el negocio goza D. buena acogida en la zona debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando allí, al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes y a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus productos. Con los ingresos que ella percibe D. esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar.

Felicita desea mejorar la infraestructura D. su negocio adquirirendo mobiliario y algunos utensilios, D. modo que sus clientes se encuentren cómodos al momento D. consumir los alimentos que prepara, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Felicita es una mujer tranquila y responsable. Todos los dias se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelante su negocio, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una buena calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Felicita, 45, is married and has two children living at home. She lives in the Peruvian district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, the most populous district in the region and the one with the highest incidence of poverty. The majority of the district's people live in or around urban areas. Felicita lives near the city of Chiclayo, ten minutes from the city's main square. Felicita operates a food business at a local market. She has a stand at the market where she sells a variety of dishes to her customers. The business is popular because her dishes are well prepared, she charges a fair price and she works when she can count on the most traffic. She uses the income from the business to help her husband with the family's expenses. Felicita wants to improve her business by buying furniture and a few utensils that will help her customers eat at the stand more comfortably. For that purpose, she is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 new-soles, her first loan from the bank. Felicita is a hard-working, responsible woman. She works as hard as she can every day to make the business a success, always with the goal of giving her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to food business.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba B. has received a junior high education. She is married and takes care of seven dependants.  Araba sells smoked fish at Elmina. Her husband is a security man.  Araba uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Araba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke (process) and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to save to build a shade over her traditionally built oven.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke (process)

loans.name: Reforma Group

texts.es:
La señora Maricela Hernández Sánchez, tiene 43 años vive en Reforma Estado de Chiapas México, está casada con el señor Santos A. H.,  con quien tuvo seis hijos una casada y cinco aún viven con ella: Luis Antonio de dieciocho años, Maricela A. en segundo semestre de preparatoria, Deiser de catorce en tercero de secundaria, Briseida Alejandra con diez años,  y la más pequeña Santa Marideli de año y medio.

 Ella se dedica a la crianza de marranos desde hace un año en donde comenta que le va muy bien desde que inicio con esta actividad, el cual también tenía un negocio de abarrotes  pero decidió quedarse con una sola actividad,  la que le brindara mayores ganancias y pudiera salir adelante.

 Su inspiración por este trabajo fue su familia para darles lo necesario ya que cada uno tiene la meta de seguir adelante, así como también apoyar a su esposo con los ingreso de su hogar y su familia.

 Con las ganancias piensa invertirlo  comprando más marranos  para criarlos y luego venderlos. Asi como también ahorrar para que sus hijos cumplan sus sueños y tengan un mejor futuro.

 El grupo se llama "Reforma" la razón del nombre es porque así se llama la comunidad donde está ubicado el  grupo.  Maricela formó parte por las promociones que se hizo en ese lugar, se informo del plan de trabajo se  intereso mucho y hoy es parte del programa.

 Las  personas que integran el grupo son las siguientes:


 María Ruth Vázquez A.: se dedica a la venta de ropas (representante del grupo).
 María Delma Sánchez E.: se dedica a vender pollos.
 María Anabel Eleria Sánchez: se dedica a vender frutas y legumbres.
 Zenaida A. López: compra y vende pollos.
 Maricela Hernández Sánchez: se dedica a la comercialización de ganados porcino como son marranos.
 Aida O. A.: tiene una tienda de ropas donde vende pantalones, blusas, playeras, camisas,  entre otros.
 Manuel A. López: se dedica a elaborar quesos y utiliza el préstamo para la compra de leche.
 María Teresa Vázquez González: vende cosméticos de catalogo.
 Blanca Madeyne Gomes G.: dedica a la sastrería de ropa.
texts.en:
Sra. Maicela H. S., 43, lives in Reforma in the Mexican state of Chiapas. She is married to Sr. Santos A. H. with whom she has six children, one married and five living at home: Luis Antonio, 18; Maricela A. who is in her second year of college; Deiser, 14 who is in the third year of high school; Briseida Alejandra, 10; and little Santa Marideli, 1 1/2. Maricela has made a living raising and selling pigs for a year. She says that the business is going well. She used to operate a grocery business, too, but she decided to concentrate on raising pigs because the returns are better. Maricela's inspiration for starting the business was her family. She wanted to provide them with whatever they needed to get ahead in the world. She also wanted to help her husband with the family's day-to-day expenses. Maricela wants to user the earnings to buy more pigs, then raise and sell them. She also wants to save for her children's future and help them fulfill their dreams. The group is called "Reforma" because it is the name of the community where the members of the group live. Maricela joined the group after seeing advertisements posted for the group around the town. The idea intrigued her and she is now a member. The members of the group are: María Ruth Vázquez A.: operates a business selling clothes (and the group's representative). María Delma Sánchez E.: operates a business selling chickens. María Anabel Eleria Sánchez: operates a business selling fruits and vegetables. Zenaida A. López: buys and sells chickens. Maricela Hernández Sánchez: buys, raises and sells pigs. Aida O. A.: owns a store where she sells pants, blouses, shirts, etc. Manuel A. López: wants to buy milk for a cheese-making business. María Teresa Vázquez González: resells cosmetics bought from catalogs. Blanca Madeyne Gomes G.: operates a tailoring business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua B. sells bags of water and soft drinks at Elmina. Efua has received a senior high education.  She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a plumber. Efua has been selling drinks and water for quite some time now. She helps her husband with the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more stock of goods (soft drinks) for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to open another shop in a different location.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods (soft drinks) to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: EFua S. is a fishmonger, married to a farmer and lives with her six dependants. She has no educational background.  Efua uses her income in support of the children’s welfare.  Efua will use the loan to obtain more fish to be able to supply more to the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To obtain more fish

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Doña Maria es madre de tres hijos, casada, desde joven a prendió a trabajar en las ventas junto con su mama.
Hace varios años vende en su propio cafetín y venta de variedades que inicio con el objetivo de poder apoyar  a su familia, y ahorrar para hacer su casa.
Con los años ah adquirido clientela y ah aumentado sus ventas a través de estos financiamientos.
También con ayuda de su esposo han logrado hacer su casa toda de concreto, educación  a sus hijos y lo necesario ya que todo esta caro, y la demanda es mucha en los mercado lo que para ella es de gran necesidad poder tener los productos que se venden mas para lograr ventas altas.
Con este préstamo comprara: un termo grande para lograr aumentar su venta de gaseosas y frescos, comprar más cajillas de coca cola, golosinas asi como variedades de cola, prensapelos, trabas, pulseras, anillos, de fantasía que se vende mucho a los adolescentes. 
Que a través de estos financiamientos esta logrando el objetivo de aumentar su inversión para tener mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Maria is married and the mother of three children. Since she was a girl, she learned to work in sales together with her mother. For the past few years, she has operated her own small café and has also sold variety goods. She started this work with the aim of helping her family and saving up to build a house. Over the years, she has attracted a customer base and has increased her sales with the help of loans. Also, with her husband's help, she has been able to build a house made of concrete, pay for children's education, and provide them with what they need, since everything is expensive. Since demand is high on the market, it is necessary for her to keep the most popular products in stock in order to achieve high sales volumes. With this loan, she will buy a large cooler so she can increase her sales of soft drinks and fresh foods; more cases of Coca-Cola; snacks and other varieties of soft drinks; and hair bands, hair clips and costume jewelry such as bracelets and rings that sell very well among adolescents. This financing will help her achieve her goal of increasing her investment to gain greater benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a large cooler and merchandise such as soft drinks, hair accessories, etc. to expand her investment

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: La Señora Diana Patricia es una mujer muy trabajadora, le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con el paro de las colegiaturas de uno de sus hijos ya que ella tambien trabaja como profesora en una escuela primaria. Este seria su primer crédito y lo requiere para el pago de colegiaturas de su pequeña hija.  Ella desea que sus hijos salgan adelante, invirtiendo en  una buena educación. La señora Diana Patricia les agradece la ayuda.
texts.en:
Sra. Diana Patricia is a hard-working woman. She works as an elementary school teacher to help her husband with the family's expenses and to pay her children's school fees. This is her first loan and she will use it to pay the school fees of her youngest daughter. She wants her children to get ahead in the world so she is investing in providing them with a good education. Diana Patricia thanks all of you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School fees.

loans.name: Yaa Sister

texts.en: Yaa Sister B. is married and has a child. She is a beautician who goes around the neighborhood of Elmina to fix and paint the nails of people. Yaa Sister is a hairdresser as well. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a trader. Yaa Sister uses her income to help her husband take care of her family. Yaa Sister will use the loan to purchase additional creams and nail polish to use in her saloon. Yaa Sister plans to reinvest the profit she hopes to make from her expanded business.

loans.use: To purchase additional creams and nail polish to use in her salon

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells cassava, plantain and palm fruit at Elmina. Ama has no educational background.  She is divorced and has six dependants. Ama has been selling foodstuffs for 30 years. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en: Adjowa E. sells oranges, groundnuts, doughnuts and bananas at Elmina.  She has received a junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. She helps her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fruit for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama T. is divorced. She has been through junior high school.  Ama sells foodstuffs at Elmina. She has been selling foodstuffs for about 15 years. Ama will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying four doors for her new house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials for improvements to house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials for kitchen project.

loans.name: Pensamientos Group

texts.es:
Ellas son "Pensamientos" un grupo conformado por 17 mujeres las cuales luchan diariamente por salir adelante y darle un mejor futuro a sus familias. Ellos se ubican en la comunidad de Valle de Chalco en el Estado de México. Los integrantes del grupo son: Lourdes P. P. (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo), Mirna Socorro González C. (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo), María del Socorro R. S. (Refaccionaria), Reyna S. C. (Industria Bordadora), Norma Zenón M. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres), Maricela C. Ramírez (Venta de Música), Paulina Ramírez González (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo), María Elena Dámaso Jiménez (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo), María D. C. (Florería), Raquel O. S. (Estética) María de Lourdes O. S. (Venta de Postres), María del Roció C. M. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres), Concepción González C. (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo), Roselía García C. (Venta de Música), María Esther Pérez H. (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo), Rosa María Martha V. J. (Materiales para Construcción) y Sara Zenón M. (Venta de Ropa Interior por Catalogo)   

Reyna S. C., es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son casados. Ella trabajaba de afanadora pero cuando enfermo de osteoporosis tuvo que dejar su trabajo ya que esta enfermedad afecto sus piernas así que decidió dedicarse a otro tipo de actividad. Hace 15 años comenzó con la elaboración de prendas tejidas a mano como: blusas, chalecos, bufandas, suéteres, chambritas, etc. Al principio fue difícil para ella pero con el tiempo y la práctica continua se le ha hecho más fácil, actualmente compra revistas para hacer prendas más modernas y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela. El crédito solicitado lo va a utilizar para la compra de hilos, ganchos, botones, cierres, etc. Reyna siempre que sale lleva consigo una prenda de muestra y aparte lleva material para ir haciendo durante el camino, su mercancía la ofrece con sus vecinos y familiares. Sus épocas de mayor venta son en las fechas especiales como cumpleaños y en épocas de frio. Con las ganancias desea apoyar a su hija que también tiene osteoporosis, a su hija le avanzó más rápido que a Reyna y desea apoyar a su hija con las terapias para que pueda volver a caminar. Los planes de Reyna son poder poner un local propio y así tener sus blusas y chalecos en exhibición para que la gente conozca el trabajo que hace y tener mayor venta.

 Ella junto con las demás integrantes agradece el apoyo que les brinda Kiva a través de Fundación Realidad para lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
This group is called "Pensamientos" ("Thoughts"), and it is made up of 17 women who are working hard every day to get ahead and provide a better future for their families. They are located in the Chalco Valley, in the State of México. The members of the group are: Lourdes P. P. (cosmetics sales by catalog), Mirna Socorro González C. (cosmetics sales by catalog), María del Socorro R. S. (auto parts sales), Reyna S. C. (machine embroidery), Norma Zenón M. (fruit and vegetable sales), Maricela C. Ramírez (music sales), Paulina Ramírez González (shoe sales by catalog), María Elena Dámaso Jiménez (cosmetics sales by catalog), María D. C. (flower sales), Raquel O. S. (beauty shop), María de Lourdes O. S. (desserts), María del Roció C. M. (fruit and vegetable sales), Concepción González C. (shoe sales by catalog), Rose lía García C. (music sales), María Esther Pérez H. (shoe sales by catalog), Rosa María Martha V. J. (construction materials), and Sara Zenón M. (lingerie sales by catalog). Reyna S. is a single mother with three children, who are already grown and married. She used to work as a cleaning lady, but when she began suffering from osteoporosis, she had to leave her job, since the condition affected her legs. She decided to dedicate herself to another kind of work, so 15 years ago, she began making hand-knitted garments such as blouses, jackets, scarves, sweaters, baby clothes, etc. At the beginning, it was hard for her, but with time and continuous practice, it became easier. At present, she buys magazines to make more modern clothing designs and satisfy her customers' needs. She will use the funds from the loan she is requesting to buy yarn, hook closures, buttons, zippers, etc. Whenever she goes out, Reyna takes a sample garment and also carries supplies to keep working during the journey. She offers her merchandise to her family members and neighbors. She makes the most sales for special days such as birthdays, and during the cold months. With her earnings, she wants to support her daughter with her therapy so that she will be able to walk again, since her daughter also has osteoporosis which is advancing very rapidly. In the future, Reyna plans to open her own store and put her blouses and jackets on display, so that people will get to know her work and she will increase her sales. Reyna and the other members are grateful for the support provided to them by Kiva through the Realidad Foundation, which will help them achieve their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying yarn, hook closures, buttons, zippers, etc.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Donaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Donaldo, vive en el Barrio Tropical y Quinto Anillo de la Av. Radial 26 de la cuidad de Santa Cruz, cuentan con casa propia en la cual vive con tres de sus hijos, dos se encuentran en el colegio y la ultima de su hijita aun esta en el kinder, esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de madera ya que en esta epoca del año tiende a subir por el mal estado de los caminos de acceso a las empresas comercializadora de madera (barracas), su esposa solo se dedica a labores del hogar, llego a nuestra oficina por promociones que se realizaron por esa zona, don Donaldo es propietario de un taller de carpinteria, su actividad principal es de hacer muebles de dormitorios, cocinas, salon de espera, comedores, etc., cuenta con varios años en esta actividad y por lo tanto ya cuenta con una clientela segura, con esta actividad es su pricncipal fuente de ingresos para sustento de su familia y cubrir su obligaciones financieras, "estoy muy agradecido con su institucion por la confianza que depositada en mi persona" fueron las palabras del cliente.
texts.en:
Donaldo lives in the Barrio Tropical y Quinto Anillo of Av. Radial 26 in the city of Santa Cruz. He has his own house and lives there with three of his children. Two are in school and the youngest, a daughter, is in kindergarten. He is requesting a loan to buy timber, as at this time of year, due to the poor state of the access roads, he tends to go up to the timber merchants. His wife takes care of the household chores. He came to our office as a result of advertising carried out in this area. He owns a carpentry workshop that mainly produces furniture for bedrooms, kitchens, living rooms and dining rooms. He has been working in this area for several years and therefore already has a secure client base. This activity is his main source of income with which he supports his family and covers his financial obligations. He says: “I am very grateful to your institution for the trust it is showing in me”.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PURCHASE TIMBER

loans.name: Paxtoca Group

texts.es: Emiliana Tomasa Cuá Cuá, estado civil casada con oficio Artesana “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos”, tiene 4 hijos, tiene el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en el extragero, pero estos meses que se aproximan aumenta la demanda de su negocio, y quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes. Los demas integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades, los cuales mencionamos: Venta de Ropa típica, elaboración de chalinas(bufandas para mujeres), costurera, Elaboración de Güipiles Típicos. Han decidido entonces unirse para solicitar un prestamos para incrementar el capital de cada uno de los integrantes y asi poder tener un negocio mas grandes y mejores ganacias. Este grupo de personas viven en cantón Paxtoca en los parajes Xecoxom 1 y 2, paraje Chibatz 1.
texts.en:
Emiliana Tomasa Cuá Cuá, is married and works as craftswoman "Making traditional clothing". She has 4 children and she has the support of her husband who works abroad. But these months that are approaching increase the demand on her business, and she wants to increase her working capital to cover the demands of her customers. The other members of this group work in diverse areas, which we will mention: sale of traditional clothing, making chalinas (scarves for women), seamstress, making traditional Güipiles (woven poncho). They have decided then to join forces to request a loan to increase the capital of each one of the members and so be able to have bigger businesses and improve profits. This group of people live in the canton of Paxtoca in Parajes Xecoxom 1 and 2, Paraje Chibatz 1.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Las Gaviotas. Esta ubicado en la comunidad de Tepalcingo, en el estado de Morelos, México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes que se conocen por ser vecinos. Este es su préstamo no. 8 con Fundación Realidad.
La integrante del grupo se llama Araceli O. B.,  tiene 34 años de edad, estudio una carrera comercial secretariado saliendo de la secundaria estudio 2 años mas de secretariado, tiene dos hijos varones, Jesús tiene 3 años, Osvaldo tiene 7 años y esta estudiando la primaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de Topperware por catalogo. Y necesita su préstamo para comprar artículos de topperware vasos, jarras, platos, cubetones de plástico para tener mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientas. Inicio su negocio hace 5 años la invitaron a una junta de demostración de los artículos que se venden, como se trabaja, los descuentos, las promociones, los regalos y le entregaron los catálogos para comenzar a vender, mete su pedido y le dan crédito de una semana a partir de la fecha que le entregan el pedido. Es importante su negocio por que de las ganancias las va utilizando para lo que falte en la casa y volver a invertir. Le gusta su negocio porque va ganando regalos y premios y procura venden mas para tener premios mas grandes, sus clientes son las amas de casa sale de su domicilio a ofrecer su productos de casa en casa, hay personas que se molestan cuando les cobra y ya no le pagan, enfrenta la competencia de varias personas que venden los mismos productos. Ella espera que sus hijos estudien y que terminen una carrera.
Tepalcingo es un lugar muy bonito han ido cambiando las calles las han remodelado también hay una feria que se celebra al Señor de Tepalcingo en el mes de Febrero o Marzo en el 3er. Viernes a partir del miércoles de ceniza, hay muchos visitantes, danzas, mariachis, ponen sus puestos de artesanías, comida, ropa, etc. de todo se puede encontrar en la feria esta muy grande y dura aproximadamente15 días.
Los integrantes del grupo son la señora Blanca Estela A. Hernández va a comprar con su préstamo refrescos por caja y por mayoreo de coca cola de 2 litros, 3 litros y de vidrio para surtir su negocio. La señora Loyda Eliuth E. Gutiérrez va a comprar armazones, liquido para lentes de contacto, plaquetas, tornillos, micas para surtir su negocio. La señora Rusbelia O. O. va a comprar mercancía por mayoreo coca cola, yogurt, detergente, clarasol, galletas, por caja para surtir su negocio. La señora Elsa O. O. va a comprar aceite, fríjol, maseca, servilletas, platos, carnes frías, verduras, gas, etc. para elaborar sus alimentos. La señora Maria Elia P. Chávez va a comprar perfumes de dama y caballero, cremas, labiales, desodorantes, sombras, etc. para surtir su negocio. La señora Judith de los Ángeles N. C. va a comprar topperware, ropa interior de dama, labiales, desodorantes etc. para surtir su negocio. La señora Maria de Jesús B. V. va a comprar mercancía refrescos y sabritas para surtir su negocio de abarrotes. La señora Araceli O. B. va a comprar vasos, jarras. Platos, cubetones de plástico para surtir su negocio. La señota Mariela E. M. va a compra catálogos y ropa interior para exhibirla y tener que vender para inicio de su negocio.  
Las integrantes del grupo quiere decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad: “gracias por apoyarnos con el préstamo y que sigan ayudando ya que hay gente que lo necesita mucho”.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Gaviotas (The Seagulls). It’s located in Tepalcingo, a town in the Mexican state of Morelos. There are 9 members, neighbors, all of whom know one another. This is their 8th Fundacion Realidad loan. The members of the group are Araceli O. B., 34, who studied at a secretarial school after leaving high school. She has two boys: Jesus, 3, and Osvaldo, 7, who is in elementary school. Araceli operates a business selling Tupperware products. She needs a loan to buy Tupperware products such as cups, plates, containers, etc. that she will resell to her customers. She started the business 5 years ago after she was invited to a showing of the products that she now sells. She learned about the work, discounting, advertising, etc. They gave her the catalogs from which she sells her products, she put in her order and they gave her a week’s credit from the date that she received the order. The business is important to Arceli. She uses the earnings from the business to support her household and buy more stock for the business. She likes the work and she has won gifts and prizes for her efforts, something that spurs her on to work harder. Her customers are housewives. She goes door to door to sell her products. She’s bothered because some people don’t pay when she goes to collect and she faces competition from others who sell the same products. She wants her children to study for a good career. Tepalcingo is a lovely place. The streets have been improved and there’s a fair to celebrate the Senor de Tepalcingo in February or March. Many visitors come after Ash Wednesday for the dancing, the mariachis and the market where vendors sell crafts, food, clothes, etc. The market is very large and goes on for about 15 days. The members of the group are Sra. Blanca Estela A. H. who will use her share of the loan to buy wholesale supplies of cold drinks; Sra. Loyda Eliuth E. G. who will buy frames for glasses, contact lens solution and other supplies for her eye care business; Sr. Rusbelia O. O. who will buy wholesale supplies of soft drinks, yogurt, detergent, candy, etc. to stock her business; Sra. Elsa O. O. who will buy cooking oil, beans maseca, napkins, plates, etc. for her food business; Sra. Maria Elia P. C. who will buy perfumes, creams, lipsticks, deodorants, etc. to supply her beauty products business; Sra. Judith de los Angeles N. C. who will buy Tupperware products, women’s clothing, lipsticks, deodorants, etc. for her business; Sra. Maria de Jesus B. Vego who will buy merchandise to stock her corner shop; Sra. Araceli O. Bahean who will buy Tupperware products for her business; Sra. Mariela E. M. who will buy catalogs and underwear that she has to sell to start her business. The members of the group want to say to Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad “thank you for supporting us with your loan and for continuing to help those of us who very much need your help”.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products, supplies, etc. for multiple businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials for kitchen improvement.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo vive en la zona de Urb. Terrado 3 en el Plan 3000, el tiene 2 hijos que asisten a primaria, su esposa tambien le ayuda, ella se dedica a la venta de bolsas plasticas,el se dedica a la soldadura y tiene su taller donde realiza trabajos de cerrajeria, elabora trabajos de tinglados,puertas arrollables, protectores, barandas y sillones. El cuenta con una maquina de soldar pequeña que no le abastece para los trabajos que realiza por lo cual con el prestamo que ha solicitado le servira para comprar una maquina de soldar mas grande y de mayor amperaje que le ayudara mucho a hacer mejores trabajos y no tendra gastos por alquilar maquinas. El  es una persona que tiene muchas ganas de superacion, muy trabajador y esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva poe la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Hugo lives in the urban district of Terrado 3 in the suburb of Plan 3000. He has two children attending elementary school. His wife helps by selling plastic bags. Hugo is a welder who has a workshop that he uses as a metal shop. He manufactures platforms, garage doors, security bars, railings, and chairs. Hugo owns a small soldering machine, but it is not adequate for the work he needs to perform.

The loan he requested will be used to buy a larger soldering machine with more voltage that will help him produce better work. This will also save him from having to rent a machine. Hugo is the type of person who wants to succeed. He is hard worker and expresses his appreciation to Emprender and Kiva for trusting him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a soldering machine

loans.name: Jorge David

texts.es:
Jorge de 34 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene una tienda de víveres desde hace años atrás. 

Por la falta de oportunidades profesionales el comenzó a vender víveres en su casa con ayuda de sus padres, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar una vitrina para su local, hasta que comenzó a completar dinero para su local, ahora el trabajn desde las 06h00 hasta las 23h00pm todos los dias. 

Para continuar con su tienda el quiere comprar con el prestamo arroz, azucar y bebidas y asi surtirlo mas, en el futuro el quiere ampliar fisicamente su tienda.
texts.en:
Jorge, 34, lives in the suburb of Guayaquil (an urbanized area where the majority of the residents run some kind of small business). He has a grocery store that he started four years ago. Due to the lack of professional opportunities he began to sell groceries out of his home with his parents’ help. With effort he gradually was able to come up with the money to buy a display case and set up his shop. He now works from 6 in the morning until 11 at night every day of the week. In order to maintain his store he wants to use the loan to buy rice, sugar and drinks and thus expand his product line. In the future he wants to enlarge his store premises.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and drinks

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Ellas son el grupo Nueva Vida, integrado por diez mujeres cada una con expectativas y metas diferentes pero todas con deseos de salir adelante y luchar cada día, ellas se sienten bien formando parte del grupo. Actualmente radican en la comunidad de Chalco, Estado de México.

Ella es Edith R. R. de 53 años de edad (la de sudadera azul marino)  tiene un hijo de 22 años quien actualmente trabaja ya que no pudo continuar con sus estudios por falta de ingresos en su hogar solo ellos dos son quienes se ayudan ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. Edith es una persona que siempre ha tenido que trabajar para poder salir adelante y así poder comprar sus medicamentos ya que ella padece de bronquitis asmática pero eso no le impide seguir luchando. Edith se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza como fibras, escobas, en su casa y también a la venta de ropa y zapatos (de 2ª mano) en los tianguis que están cerca de su comunidad, coloca sus mantas para exhibir la ropa, en ocasiones le afectan las lluvias ya que es cuando menos vende, pero sus días de mayor venta son los fines de semana, trata de surtir su mercancía cada tercer día para poder tener variedad. Con el crédito solicitado ella podrá comprar un poco mas de ropa para su negocio al igual que sus productos de limpieza, sus planes son poder construir una pequeña accesoria en su domicilio y que su hijo pueda retomar sus estudios nuevamente y así tener un mejor futuro. 

Los integrantes de este grupo son:  
Virginia Mejía Gutiérrez (Albañilería)Representante del grupo
Edith R. R. (la señora de la historia- venta de productos de limpieza y ropa de segunda mano)
María Trinidad J. Benítez (Venta de Artículos Domésticos)                           
Fabiola Benítez J. (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo)
Irma Godínez T. (Venta de Antojitos)                        
Guly Gema Méndez Z. (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo)    
Irma Hernández C. (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo)       
Gloria Hernández C. (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo)
Maximina P. S. (Venta de Abarrotes) 
Roció Hernández Sánchez (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo)

El grupo esta muy agradecido por haber recibido el crédito de Kiva a través de Fundación Realidad.
texts.en:
This group is called Nueva Vida ("New Life"), and it is made up of ten women, each of them with different goals and expectations, but all of them with the desire to get ahead and work hard each day. They are happy to be part of this group. They are currently headquartered in the community of Chalco, in the State of México. This borrower is Edith R. R., age 53 (the one in the navy blue sweatshirt). She has a daughter who is 22 and currently working, since she could not continue her studies due to a lack of income in the household. They only have each other for support, since Edith does not receive support from her partner. Edith is a person who has always had to work to get ahead and to buy her medicines, since she suffers from asthmatic bronchitis, but this does not stop her from continuing to work hard. Her business is selling cleaning products such as brooms and fibers out of her home, and also selling secondhand clothing and shoes at the markets near her community. She lays out blankets to display the clothes. At times her business is affected by rain and she sells less. Her best sales days are the weekends. She tries to stock new merchandise every three days so she can offer variety to her customers. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy a little more clothing for her business, along with cleaning products. Her plans for the future are to construct a small extra room in her home and to see her daughter return to her studies so that she can have a better future. The other members of this group are: María Trinidad J. Benítez (Home products sales) Fabiola Benítez J. (Cosmetics sales by catalog) Irma Godínez T. (Snacks sales) Guly Gema Méndez Z. (Cosmetics sales by catalog) Irma Hernández C. (Shoe sales by catalog) Virginia Mejía Gutiérrez (Mason), Group representative Gloria Hernández C. (Cosmetics sales by catalog) Maximina P. S. (Grocery store) Roció Hernández Sánchez (Shoe sales by catalog) The group very much appreciates receiving the loan from Kiva through the Realidad Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying secondhand clothing and shoes as well as cleaning products to sell

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: La Sra. Mariela vive en el Barrio Pepe Lucho Zona Av. Internacional en el Plan 3000, ella tiene un hijo de un año, su esposo se dedica al transporte publico, trabaja de lunes a domingo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, en la cual tiene el apoyo de su esposo,ella hace diferentes platos, los sabados vende kjaras y los domingos hace Patasca, estos platos son tipicos de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, el prestamo es para ampliar su puesto de venta de comida y terminar de colocar techo para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y para comprar insumos para elaboracion de sus comidas como aceite, papa, especias, etc . Su esposo cuenta con su propio vehiculo que lo trabaja el mismo .Ella es una persona activa que se esfuerza junto con su esposo para llevar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Mariela lives in the Pepe Lucho neighborhood, International Avenue Zone in Plan 3000. She has a son one year of age. Her husband is dedicated to public transportation. She works from Monday to Sunday. She is dedicated to the sale of food, in which she has the support of her husband. She makes different dishes. On Saturdays she sells kjaras and Sundays she makes pork stew. These are traditional dishes of the city of Santa Cruz. The loan will be used to expand her stall for selling food and to finish to adding a ceiling to give better service to her clients. In addition she will buy supplies for making her foods such as oil, potatoes, spices, etc. Her husband relies on his own vehicle which he uses in his business. . She is an active person that endeavors along with her husband to move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for making the foods she sells and to improve the stall where she sells her foods

loans.name: Zoraya Elizabeth

texts.es:
Zoraya de 38 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene un restaurante desde que se separo de su esposo para poder mantener a sus dos hijos. 

Ella comenzo con una mesa y una silla a vender comida a sus conocidos y vecinos, pero como la demanda de comida ella mucha decidio comprar mas mesas y ubicar su negocio ya en un local, por esa buena decision  ahora ella trabaja con una de sus hijas desde la mañana hasta la cena haiendo platos como "Yapingachos", "guatita" etc. 

Para poder continuar con su negocio ella necesita comprar mas viveres como arroz, carnes y bebidas, en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y tener sucursales de restaurantes.
texts.en:
Zoraya, 38-years-old, lives in Primavera de Duran (an outlying area with a disappearing ecosystem in the outskirts of Guayaquil). Ever since she separated from her husband she's had a restaurant in order to support her two children.
