Con el préstamo ella podrá ampliar su negocio y nivel de ventas, asimismo la calidad de vida de su familia mejorará. Regina es una mujer trabajadora y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos.
texts.en:
Regina is a 29-year-old mother that lives along with her husband and two under-age children in the Sandial sector, a rural population center of the district of Pítipo. This is an agricultural district of the province of Ferreñafe, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Regina has been dedicated to breeding smaller animals for four years in her residence. When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to her neighbors and to the businessmen that always visit the place where she lives. She feeds her animals with concentrated food and fodder, in this way she guarantees the rapid growth of her animals, which permits her to market them in better way and to receive greater profits. Regina desires to expand her business with the purchase of sheep which she plans to work in the same way: fattening and selling them in the same zone;. To achieve her objective she has seen the need for the first time to request a loan of 500 new soles from EdpymeAlternativa. With the loan she will be able to expand her business and her level of sales, and likewise improve the quality of life of her family. Regina is a hard-working woman, well thought of by her neighbors and acquaintances.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction materials to replace roof of home

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Cesar Vallejo del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito más poblado de la región Lambayeque, es también el distrito con mayores índices de pobreza, debido a que la mayor parte de su población reside en zonas urbano – marginales. Se encuentra situado cerca a la ciudad de Chiclayo, a diez minutos de la plaza central de la ciudad de Chiclayo,

Se dedica a la comercialización de verduras en el mercado Atusparias, este centro de abastos es uno de los mas importantes de su distrito, ella cuenta con una clientela fiel que siempre acude a su puesto de venta para solicitar verduras frecas y en buenas condiciones, para poder mantenerse en el rubro ella trata de brindar los mejores productos con una buena atención a sus clientes.

Gladys desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mas ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Gladys es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo la conideran una mujer de confianza y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 36-year-old mother that lives with her family in the Cesar Vallejo sector of the José Leonardo Ortiz district, the most populated district of the Lambayeque region. This is also the district with the most poverty, due to the fact that most of its population resides in marginal urban zones. It is located close to the city of Chiclayo, ten minutes from the central plaza of the city of Chiclayo, Fladys is dedicated to the commercialization of vegetables in the Atusparias market. This center of supplies is one of the most important of her district. She relies on a faithful clientele that always frequent her sales position to request fresh vegetables in good condition. To maintain her business in the area she tries to offer the best products with good attention to her clients. Gladys desires to expand her business with the purchase of more products, so that she can expand her sales and receive more income that will permit her to improve her family's situation. To achieve her objective she has requested a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternative. Gladys is a hard-working and enterprising woman. Her neighbors and coworkers consider her a trustworthy woman and quite responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to grow her business

loans.name: Chroeb's Group

texts.en: This group loan has four members who live in Chheu Neang Khpos village province. Mrs. Chroeb N. is a group leader who was born in 1974, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family while her husband, Mr. Bunthoeurn Pen, is a motorbike repair at her local village. Her problem is that her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Chroeb N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other is enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvement: will change electrical system and flooring

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Lay Ear Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nine people are made up a village bank loan in which located in Sdok Prei village, Takeo province. Mrs. Kim Lay E. is a village bank president who is 28-yE.-old, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for varied ways. She is a food seller at Tameou Mountain where she is able to earn some money to support her family while her husband, Mr. Boeurn Bing, is a grass chopper. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve her face business, Mrs. Kim Lay E. is asking for a loan to buy chicken, drinks to resale. She is a mother of a child who is six years old.

loans.use: To buy chicken, drinks to resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a used vehicle for work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase farming supplies for growing basic grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Haciendo Un Mundo Mejor (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Haciendo un mundo Mejor esta formado por 13 mujeres que con el trabajo diario buscan mejorar el porvenir de sus familias,  se dedican a varias labores  con un fin en común, el de mejorar la economía de sus familias. Viven por distintos lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica,  su  centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

La Señora Carmen Merchán vive por la parroquia de Turi comunidad Santa Anita, es su primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia; se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos vendiendo sus animales en las ferias de la ciudad, para mejorar mas la economía de su hogar hace 7 meses ha empezado a trabajar en una guardería, laborando de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m.
Nuestra socia tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 8, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad,  sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la construcción ya que es albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
Ahora con su primer crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y su alimento. Su meta es tener agua potable en su casa y también desea crecer  en su negocio.

La Señora María Q. vive por la parroquia de Turi comunidad Santa Anita, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene 10 hijos de los cuales  5 son casados y viven de manera independiente, 4 son solteros que trabajan y le ayudan económicamente en  su hogar y su última hija este año ingresa al colegio, su esposo trabaja en la área de la construcción como albañil, gracias al trabajo en conjunto han logrado tener su casa propia.
Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de animales como: pollos, chanchos y vacas que le dan leche que consume y vende,  también se dedica a la agricultura sembrando hortalizas como: lechugas, zanahorias vendiendo su producto en las ferias de la ciudad.
Es su primer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus chanchos y también desea  hacer una chanchera, su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank known as 'Making a Better World' is made up of 13 women that seek to improve the future of their families with their daily work. They are dedicated to several business with an end in common; that of improving the economy of their families. They live in different areas of the city of Cuenca, a city that is recognized for its architectural beauty. Its historic center was declared a world heritage by Unesco in the year 1999. Señora Carmen Merchán lives in the Turi parish of the community of Santa Anita. This is her first loan that she has requested from the communcal bank. She was invited by a friend who is an associate. She is dedicated to raising chickens and pigs, selling her animals in the markets of the city. To improve the economy of her home, she began working an a preschool 7 months ago, laboring from Monday to Friday from 8 to.m. to the 4 p.m. Our associate is 26 years old. She is married and has 4 children ages 8, 6, 4 and 2 years. Her two first children study in a school of the city. Her husband is dedicated to construction since he is a bricklayer. With their combined work they have managed to build their own house. Now with her first loan she is going to invest it in the purchase of chickens and food for them. Her goal is to have drinking water in her house and she also desires to grow her business. Señora María Q. lives in the Turi parish of the community of Santa Anita. She is 53 years of age, married and has 10 children of which 5 are married and live independently, 4 are single and work to help economically in her home and her last daughter enters school this year. Her husband works in the area of construction as a bricklayer. Thanks to their combined work they have managed to have their own house. Our associate is dedicated to the raising of animals such as: chickens, pigs and cows that give milk which she both consumes and sells. She is also dedicated to agriculture, sowing vegetables like lettuce and carrots and selling her product in the markets of the city. This is her first loan and she is going to invest it in the purchase of food for her pigs and also she desires to buy a sow. Her goal is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase zinc, sand, blocks, and other materials for making improvements to his home

loans.name: Mr. Phy Khy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Phy K. is a village bank president who was born in 1953, selected by eighteen people whom all are made up a village bank loan located in Ampil Rieng village, Takeo province. All the members will use portion of their loan for varied ways in which it can improve their businesses in the current year. Mr. Phy K. is a village chief in this village where he gets low salary to support his family while his wife, Mrs. Segn Hea, is a farmer who owns one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her wife. His problem is that his wife’s field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mr. Phy K. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer. He is a father of a child who is a teacher.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Sarin Sa Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has eighteen people who live in Trapeang Angk village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sarin S. is a village bank president who was born in 1959, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for varied goals. She is widow with a child who is a seamstress in garment factory. Her position is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. They all do work a lot but they can earn less income. So to improve condition family living, Mrs. Sarin S. is seeking for a loan to buy piglets, pig food, and cement to build pigsty to start new business.

loans.use: To buy piglets, pig food, and cement to build pigsty to start new business

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoen S. and her husband, Mr. Sun Sam, have been married since 1989 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of her daughters is married, the son is a garment factory worker, and the other daughter attends school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Yoen is a rice farmer. Her husband raises cows at home and also assists his wife in the farming business. She asked for a Kiva loan once already, and she now is requesting her second loan of $1,000 to bury a drainage pipe, and buy fertilizer to put on her rice farm.

loans.use: To bury a drainage pipe and buy fertilizer to put on her rice farm.

loans.name: Mr. Ny Yung Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people have been selected Mr. Ny Y. is a village bank president who is 56-year-old located in Prey Sambuor village in Takeo province. All members will use portion of their loan for different purposes in which it can improve their businesses. Mr. Ny Y. and his wife, Mrs. Sieb Chhun, are farmers who owns one point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family living. Although they try to work hard they can earn less income. So to improve condition family living, Mr. Ny Y. is asking for a loan to buy a fishing boat to start a new business. He is a father of four children, two of whom is laborers, while the others are enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Sichat

texts.en:
Miss Sichat K., is single, and lives with her brother and elderly father on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has been a silk weaver for more than 20 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

She is asking for another loan in the amount of $200 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: María Esther

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and sell

loans.name: Sut

texts.en:
Mrs. Sut S. (pictured here), is 40 years old and her husband, Mr. Sophal Sun, is 38 years old. They have been married since 1999 and have three children: one daughter who is a silk weaver and two sons who attend school.  The family lives on an island in Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sut has been a silk weaver for 20 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a soldier. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to build a kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane P. is from the village of Brgy. Dadap, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 4 infant-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling home products such as glasses, plastic wares, and watches in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Dela

texts.es:
Dela es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el sector El Sandial, una centro poblado rural del distrito de Pítipo, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Ferreñafe, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores desde hace cuatro años en su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en done vive. Ella alimenta a sus animales con alimento concentrado y forraje, el cual sembrado por su esposo de este modo garantizan el rapido crecimiento de sus animales, lo que les permite comercializarlos de mejor manera y percibir mayores ganancias.

Dela desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de ovejas con las cuales piensa trabajar del mismo modo: engordándolas y vendiéndolas en la misma zona, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Con el préstamo ella podrá ampliar su negocio y nivel de ventas, asimismo la calidad de vida de su familia mejorará. Dela es una mujer entregada a su familia y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos.
texts.en:
Dela is a 39-year-old mother who lives with her husband and son in the El Sandial sector, a rural town center in the Pítipo district. The agricultural district is in the Ferreñafe province, which is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. She has been breeding small animals for four years out of her home. When they have reached a good size, she sells them to her neighbors and to the merchants who always visit the place where she lives. She gives her animals concentrated feed and fodder planted by her husband, thus ensuring the rapid growth of their animals and allowing them to market the animals better and realize more income. Dela wants to expand her business with the purchase of sheep. She is thinking of operating the same way with the sheep: to fatten and sell them in the same area. To achieve her goal she finds it necessary to request a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of $200. With the loan proceeds, she will be able to grow her business and her level of sales, at the same time improving her family's standard of living. Dela is a woman devoted to her family and esteemed by his neighbors and acquaintances.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep for breeding business expansion and for sale.

loans.name: Borith

texts.en:
Mr. Borith P., 35, and his wife, Mrs. Houch Real (pictured together), 30, have been married since 2003 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One attends school and other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Borith is a motor taxi driver and fisherman. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children. The house where they live is old and breaks down in some parts, and Borith wants to repair it but he does not have money. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

Sithon is applying for her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Mrs. Samoeun Khuon Village Bank Group

She is a farmer who owns one point five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and she is also a pig breeder while her husband, Mr Sophorn Svay, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Samoeun K. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of a child.

Two of them are garment factory workers, one attends school, and other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Sothea N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can grow rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Dy Phorn, is a motorbike middleman who is able to earn money to support his family. Mrs. Hun B. owns a general store in local village where she can sell groceries to earn large profit to support her family while her husband, Mr. Chav Phan, is a sugar palm seller who is also able to earn money to support his family. loans.name: Rowel

texts.en:
Rowel V. is from the village of Burgos. He is 38 years old. Rowel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rowel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rowel has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP when he sells his raised pigs.

In 2010, Rowel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowel is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rowel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: 05.05.01- Hoang Phong 2- Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thúy Lê thị (1) is a 33 year old female living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Thúy is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 05.05.01- Hoang Phong 2- Hoang Hoa (05.05.01- Hoang Phong 2- Hoang Hoa).

Thúy is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To making a living, Thúy operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Thúy has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thúy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,062,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thúy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Lê thị Vinh (2) is a 42 year old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
2.  N. thị Thủy (3) is a 28 year old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
3.  N. thị Nghị (4) is a 36 year old female who is requesting a 2,442,600 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
4.  Lê thị Hòa (5) is a 53 year old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Thúy Lê thị (1) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Thúy là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Thúy thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thúy kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND. Thúy đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,062,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.name: Melben

texts.en:
Melben S. is from the town of Dumabel, Aglipay, Quirino. He is 38 years old. Melben is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melben owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a chainsaw. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from being a chainsaw operator. Melben has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melben joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melben has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. Melben is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services again. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Melben from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren O. is 40 years old and lives with her three children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger (a traditional housing tent). Her three children attend a local middle school and the family has been living in the city for four years.

Lhagvasuren operates a food retailing business out of a small rented kiosk. She started her business in 2006 with the working capital of 100,000 MNT and since then, it has increased 6 times. Her business is very important to her and her family. She says, "My only wish is to be able to support my children to be better and well-educated people in the future”. Lhagvasuren is an easy going and hardworking woman who is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

To make a living, Roger owns and operates a business venture in the transportation sector, operating a motorcycle transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Roger has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda G., 60, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Edito G. and they are blessed in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own direct-selling business of undergarments, clothing and cosmetics for the past few years.

Rosalinda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her direct-selling business.

To ensure the success of her business, Rosalinda would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business, enabling her to buy advance orders for the customers of her direct-selling line.

Rosalinda dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy advance orders for the customers of her direct-selling line

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg P. is 52 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (a traditional Mongolian housing tent) in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her husband is handicapped, but works as a carpenter and an ironsmith in their town, while her son is a masonry worker for a private construction company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Narantsetseg operates a sewing business in her town and mainly produces tent covers and some clothing, as well as running a cow farming business. The family feeds 10 cows and milks 6 of them and would like to enlarge their cow farm in the future. Narantsetseg is a modest, hard working and creative woman, who is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to expand her cow farm business.

loans.use: To expand her cow farm.

loans.name: Olzvoi

texts.en:
Olzvoi T. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in their own ger (a traditional housing tent) in Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her elder daughter is a student and the two younger daughters help her business, while her husband works as a safety officer in a mining company in the countryside.

She started her business two years ago at a rental stall in one of the biggest trade centers called Mars in their city. Olzvoi would like to expand her product offerings, and is therefore requesting a 650,000 MNT loan in order to buy a greater variety of products such as earrings, necklaces, rings and other accessories to sell.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon T. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 54 years old. Simeon is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Simeon owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Simeon has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Simeon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simeon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Simeon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Simeon from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 36-year-old mother of four who lives in Los Chiles, located in the Northern region of Costa Rica. Marina lives with her husband and two children. Like many member of the Los Chiles community, Marina is a farmer. She dedicates her time to the planting and harvesting of various subsistence and revenue generating crops including chili peppers among others. Marina´s husband hires himself out to other farmers in the region as a paid laborer. This work helps to complement the money earned from the sale of the family's own produce. 

This loan will be used to finance the production of Habanero chili peppers.  Specifically, Marina will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, tools, pesticides, and other materials/ingredients necessary for the production of chili peppers. All labor and transportation tasks will be carried out by Marina and her family. 

In the mornings, Marina carries out domestic tasks such as housework and tending to the children. In the afternoons, Marina joins her husband to work their own plot of land. Marina´s goal is to increase the yield of her farm. She hopes to earn enough revenue from the production of chili peppers to keep her children in school. She hopes to improve her economic situation and offer a better standard of living to her family. A major difficulty and limitation for Marina has been her lack of working capital combined with previously unsuccessful harvesting seasons. She hopes to use this loan effectively to improve life on the farm for everyone.

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or, PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Los Chiles, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Marina, her family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Marina wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. She wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients to produce chili peppers

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a member of Faulu Kenya.  She has been operating a mobile-money transfer business as well as a pharmacy for four years.  She also sells mobile phones.  She is a former employee of Telcom Kenya (a well-known company and provider of mobile phone service).  

Through her work experience, she has learned how to sell phones and also the mobile-money transfer business.  She wants to take out her first loan of 50,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  With the loan, she will buy drugs to sell in her pharmacy and also buy mobile phones for resale.

loans.use: To buy drugs and mobile phones for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Leab Huy Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Ba Noy village, Takeo province has eighteen people who are made up a village bank loan. All they will use portion of their loan for varied ways in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Leab H. is a village bank president who is 49 years old, selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family and she is also a knitter. Her problem is that her field is infertile soil and it has a lot insect. So to improve production, Mrs. Leab H. is seeking for a loan to bU. fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline. She is widow with a child who is studying in local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Elphas

texts.en:
Elphas is 57 years old and the father of six.  He is a plumber and his wife is a farmer.  He has been in the plumbing business for over twenty years.  

As a businessman, he needed to save his money so he joined Blessed Kawaida group in Faulu Kenya. He previously took out a loan of 40,000 KES through the group so as to develop his business and later repaid.  

He has requested another loan of 50,000 KES to buy plumbing equipment and supplies. He hopes to open a big garage in the future.

loans.use: To buy plumbing equipment

loans.name: Sadikjon

texts.ru: Джаханов Садыкджон житель района А. Джоми. Ему 51 год. Он является женатым мужчиной и любящим отцом 4 детей. Имеет средне - специальное образование, шофер. По профессии проработал 7 лет. Сейчас он занимается торговлей на рынке. Продает приправы, семена бобовых и зернобобовых культур. В этой области уже 4 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Клиент хочет расширить свой бизнес и на полученную прибыль женить детей.
texts.en:
Sadikjon J. is a resident of the A. Jomi region. He is 51 years old. He is a married man and a loving father of four children. He has specialized secondary education, a driver. He has worked in this profession for seven years. At this time he sells on the market. He sells spices and different kinds of seeds and cereals. He has been in this field for four years. He is taking out the loan to increase sales. He wants to expand his business and use the profit to wed his children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is 28 years old and married with one child.  For seven years, he has been selling charcoal and firewood.  He also runs a retail shop.  

He is a member of Tinganga Jikaze group in Faulu Kenya. Being a member of the group, he can be guaranteed a loan from Faulu Kenya. He has requested  a loan of 50,000 KES to buy charcoal and firewood to resell.

He hopes to expand his shop into a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 40 years old and married to a police officer.  The couple is blessed with two children, Bob Dennis, 19, and Brian Mutugi, 12.  The couple works hard to educate their children.  

Lilian earns her income from Vineyard Chemist where she has employed one person.  She has been in the business for four years.  She was previously selling clothes and doing printing for a fee.  

She has been an active member of Granary group in Faulu Kenya and has requested a loan of 40,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy drugs for resale in her pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy drugs to sell in her pharmacy

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 29-year-old married lady with two children.  She earns her living from Lucy’s Fashion and Design shop where she makes dresses.  Her business is just one year old and she has one employee. Previously she operated a butcher shop.  Lucy works hard together with her husband, who works in a hotel, to pay school fees for their children. 

She is a member of Faith Imani group in Faulu Kenya.  Being in the group, she has previously taken out 20,000 KES which she used to boost the business. The group has guaranteed her another loan of 30,000 KES because she paid her previous loan well.  She wants to use this loan to buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Group 1

texts.en: Lorna A. owns and operates a business rating a pump boat. Her main source of income comes from selling fresh fish like pirit, malansi, guto and others in her community. She is 49 years old, married and has three grown-up children. Lorna is from the village of Hasaan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She has been in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to provide for the financial needs of her family. Lorna is the leader of a three member group accessing a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is the wife of G. H. and they reside in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.
 
A very caring lady, Bushra stays at home, manages the household chores and takes care of her family. She is fond of cooking. She cooks healthy food for her family so they can remain healthy and do their work efficiently. 

Her husband is involved in selling clothes. He sells the clothing in different areas on his bicycle by announcing in a loud voice about his clothes variety. He starts his work at 9am and goes back home at 7pm. In this way he generates income for the family. 

Now he wants to enhance his business by improving his selling. This can only happen when he buys good quality and well designed clothes to introduce into the clothing market.  Therefore, Bushra has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will achieve his wish by buying good clothes in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for reselling

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio T. is from the village of Minongan, Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 27 years old. Rogelio is single. To make a living, Rogelio owns & operates a  motorela or habal-habal service to local community members. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rogelio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rogelio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Fiderico

texts.en:
Fiderico B. Jr. is from the village of Minongan, Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 30 years old. Fiderico is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Fiderico owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Fiderico has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fiderico joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Fiderico is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Fiderico from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

To make a living, Benbinedo owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Benbinedo has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Benbinedo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Benbinedo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Benbinedo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Lilian Akinyi

texts.en:
Lilian Akinyi is 28 years old, married, and a happy mother of three children. Previously she owned a tailoring business, but due to increasing family size she realized that the income was very meager and could not adequately sustain her family's needs. 

In the year 2000 she started a retail shop in Nyamasaria so as to widen her income base, a venture she describes as very rewarding. Her quest to expand it has been met with inadequate capital, and that is why she has applied for loan worth 30,000 KES through K-MET, in liaison with KIVA lenders, to enable her to expand her business. 

Her future goal is to own a wholesale shop and be able to provide her children with a better education.  She lives in Nyamasaria and normally purchases her stock every three days at Kibuye market.

loans.use: Increase Stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elezer

texts.en:
Elezer E. is from the village of Cawayan, Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 28 years old. Elezer is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elezer owns & operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling scrap metal & other used-products in the local community. Elezer has been engaged in his business for over 1 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elezer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Elezer is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elezer from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Group 5

texts.en:
Manuelita T. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Manuelita is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Manuelita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Manuelita owns & operates a business selling a variety products like vegetables (petchay,tankong,batong) and fruits (banana, avocado and more) in the local community. Manuelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Manuelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Manuelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Manuelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more product in expanding the business.

loans.name: Linet Awino

texts.en:
Linet Awino O. has been a cereal dealer since the year 2007.  She started the business after she found that she could not support her family on the meager salary she was receiving, and so quit her job. Her business is located in Nyamasaria market. 

To boost her business she requested a loan of Ksh.20000 from KMET/KIVA micro finance initiative which she believes will enable her to maintain a good supply and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a remarkable return that will help her afford quality education for her children. She normally travels to Kibuye market to purchase her stock weekly. 

She is 30 years old, married, and a proud mother of two children.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar is a citizen of a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.
  
Naseem is a very supportive and caring lady. She manages her household chores efficiently and takes care of her family.  She is a good-natured woman who likes to take care of people and loves to help those in need. Her group members appreciate this quality in her.
  
Her husband's name is A. A., and he is involved in a garment-selling business. He sells children's and men's garments in different areas of the community and to clothing shops as well. He purchases the garments from the city Lahore (famous for its new designs and variety). His clothing collection attracts more customers in his community. Now, by the grace of God, he has started getting good orders from the clothing shops and to fulfill the orders on time he needs to buy garments in bulk. 

Therefore, Naseem has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy garments in bulk and fulfill the orders from his customers and earn a good income.

loans.use: Purchase garments for fulfilling orders

loans.name: Phyjesmael

texts.en: Phyjesmael S. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. He is 22 years old, married and has one infant child. To make a living, Phyjesmael owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Phyjesmael has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Phyjesmael joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phyjesmael is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Phyjesmael from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Perla Grace

texts.en: Perla Grace A. is from the village of Danlugan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Perla Grace owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products such as homba, dinugoan, ginagmay and more in the local community. Perla Grace has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Perla Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Perla Grace is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Perla Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase ingredients in expanding the business

loans.name: Alice Atieno

texts.en:
Alice Atieno O. has a strong desire to be self-reliant economically. That is why, after pursuing her training in tailoring, she decided to establish a tailoring business in the year 1998 in Nyamasaria where she is also a resident, to get income to realize her dream of economic dependency. She often purchases her stock once a month at Kibuye market in Kisumu. 

As an entrepreneur, she has been very innovative and for this reason, she has been able to realize an influx of customers. She needs a large amount of stock to be able to meet their demands. Since she lacks enough capital to improve her business, she applied for a loan grant worth 15,000 from K-MET micro finance, which will be used to increase stock. She believes that with the loan she will be able to earn enough income to help her achieve her life objective of economic stability. She is 34 years old, married and a mother of four children.

loans.use: To increase her stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin C. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal East, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 28 years old. Marvin is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Marvin owns & operates a business cultivating coconut trees & harvesting its fruit for sale. Marvin has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marvin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase the crop yield. Marvin is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marvin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Angelita joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Angelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Florence Atieno

texts.en:
Florence Atieno Ochieng' is a business lady who runs a hotel (simple restaurant) in Nyamasaria. She started this business in 2006 in order to generate income and enhance the food available for her children. Due to the family needs she realized that being a housewife would not help the situation and she needed to assist her husband in meeting the family needs. She normally restocks on a weekly basis buying items at Kibuye market in Kisumu.

She would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to help her diversify her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to use the profit earned to buy a plot of land to construct rental houses to get income which will enable her to increase her socio-economic status. Florence is 32 years-old and the married mother of four children.  She lives in Kisumu.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira is a 31 year-old married woman who lives in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala is famous for its shrines. 

Nasira is uneducated because she was unable to get an education due to her parents’ poor financial condition. She is very naturally talented. She learnt cooking and sewing from her mother which has proved helpful in her married life. She cooks delicious food for her family and sometimes sews clothes for her children so they can wear new clothes. She has good managing skills as well. She saves money after meeting daily expenses for the rainy days.  

Her husband's name is K. H. who has a bed-sheet selling business. Bed-sheets are the specialty of the city of Multan where people make handmade bed sheets. K. H. goes to Multan to buy the bed-sheets to sell in his native city of Borewala. 

Nasira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, her husband will buy bed-sheets in bulk which will cut down the cost of his travelling and increase his earnings.

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Husna's Group

texts.en:
Husna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s bed sheet selling business. 

Husna is 40 years-old and a married woman from the city of Borewala in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms which she keeps clean all the time. Husna is a very caring and talented lady. She not only manages her family needs but also operates a clothes embroidery business. She does this work to earn extra income. 

Her husband, S., is involved in a bed sheet selling business. He buys bed-sheets from the city of Multan because it is the specialty of Multan for people to make handmade bed-sheets. He has been in this business for over ten years. 

Husna hopes that buying the bed-sheets in bulk will cut down the cost of his travelling and enable him to have a good bulk stock to help him fulfill the orders of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Evans Ouma

texts.en:
Evans Ouma O. is 29 years old, married and the happy father of three children. He operates a retail shop ( sells sugar, cooking oil,flour, soap, kerosene, bread, milk etc) at Nyamasaria market, a business he started in the year 1990. Evans testifies how hard masonry work was and with the little income he earned, he could not adequately meet the daily needs of his family and that is why he started this business: to generate more income. 

With the training he got as a community health worker, he came to realize the wonderful initiative of revolving loan fund and decided to join K-MET to access a loan amounting to Ksh 50,000 Kenyan shillings to enable him boost his business and get a substantial income, which can help him improve the living standard of his family. He intends to expand the business to a wholesale level. He normally purchases his stock at Kibuye market in Kisumu.

loans.use: Increase stcck

loans.name: Kipawa Group

texts.en:
Sharifa H., age 40, is married with five children ages 27, 23, 20, 18 and 14 years. For six years now, she has sold fabrics and sarongs by going from door to door, and also chapatti (an unleavened flatbread, similar to tortillas). She works from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. daily and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $73

This will be Sharifa’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She hopes to obtain this loan to buy baking flour, cooking oil, and charcoal.

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group, Kipawa Group, which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture Sharifa is first on the left in the front row.

loans.use: To buy a sack of flour, cooking oil and charcoal

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Balbino

texts.en:
Balbino C. Jr. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 48 years old. Balbino is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Balbino raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Balbino has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) during a harvest season.

In 2010, Balbino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Balbino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Balbino is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Balbino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru: Косимов Насим житель района Рудаки. Возраст, 23 года. Холост. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке города Душанбе, где продает женское нижнее белье. Этот бизнес приносит доход. Кредит просит для того чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара. На полученную прибыль клиент хочет открыть свой магазин.
texts.en:
K. Nasim lives in Rudaki. He's twenty-three years old, single and has a high school education. He owns a small shop on the central market of Dushanbe, where he sells women's lingerie, something he has been involved in for over five years. This is a profitable business. He's asking for a loan to provide some variety in his range of products. With the profits, he would open a store.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase assortment of products

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie A.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling household products like casseroles, clocks and many more in her community. She is 35 years old, married and has six school-age children. They are from the village of Bagontaas, Valencia City, Bukidnon. Rosalie has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jitegemee Group

texts.en: Irene C., age 43, is a widow with three children, ages 23, 18 and 16 years. She has had a poultry business for one year now. She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $201. This will be Irene’s second Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Irene hopes for another Motisha loan to buy chicken feed. Irene will share this loan with her loan group Jitegemee which has 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. In the picture, Irene is first on the left, standing, and wearing a white dress.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Nancy Akoth

texts.en:
Nancy Akoth O. is a business lady who operates a shoe-vending and clothes-selling business in Nyamasaria market in Kisumu. She started this business in 2009 after quitting her previous business of ice cream vending since she could not earn a reasonable income to cater for the needs of her family.

Today, Nancy admits that the return has left a remarkable glee in her face and this is what has actually inspired her to expand this venture. Her main aim of joining K-MET was to access a loan of Kshs 20,000 which will enable her expand her business.

Nancy lives in Kisumu. She is 31 years old, married, and the proud mother of three children. She plans to save the profits from her expanded business to buy a passenger service vehicle which she believes will enable her to attain her life dream of ensuring economic stability for her children and enable her to educate them.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

texts.en:

To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business buying and selling firewood and charcoal in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional firewood and charcoal to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Ахмедова Лола жительница города Душанбе. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее, экономист. По профессии не работает. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку в торговом центре, где продает женское нижнее белье. Муж временно не работает. Она одна обеспечивает семью. Кредит просит для увеличения товарооборота, т.е. на приобретение сезонного товара.
texts.en:
Lola A. is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is 42 years old. She is married and has three children. She has high education, she is an economist although does not work in this profession. She is in retail. Lola has own vendor spot in the shopping center where she sells women's underwear. Her husband is temporarily not working. She is supporting the family herself. She is asking for a loan to increase sales and buy seasonal merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal merchandise
